loans.name: Ayawavi

texts.fr: Afin d'augmenter son activité de vente de sacs,de chaussures et d'habits madame Ayawavi sollicite un premier crédit pour atteindre son objectif. Elle espère multiplier ses points de vente et assurer ses besoins élémentaires. Âgée de 27ans, elle a une ancienneté de 05ans dans l'activité.
texts.en: Ayawavi's goal is to increase her professional activity and sell more bags, shoes and clothes.  To this end, she is requesting a first loan.  She hopes to be able to open additional retail outlets and to take care of her basic needs.  She is 27 years old and has been involved in this business for five years.

loans.use: to buy shoes, bags and clothes.

loans.name: Esther

texts.fr: Esther est une femme de 35 ans, célibataire et mère d'un enfant. elle a un mini restaurant qu'elle possède depuis 5 ans dans un quartier de la ville. elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de matières premières (stock d’œufs et pâtes alimentaires) afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et d'augmenter ses chiffres d'affaires et ses profits. les bénéfices générés vont lui permettre d'investir dans son activité et d'assouvir les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Esther is 35 years old, single, and the mother of one child.  She owns a mini-restaurant which she has been running for five years in one of her city's neighborhoods.  She is taking this loan in order to boost her stock of food products (eggs and pasta).  This will, in turn, help her to meet her customers' needs, and to increase her sales and profits.  She will use her profits to invest in her business and fulfill her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy food products such as eggs and pasta.

loans.name: Dora Angelica

texts.es:
La socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de broasteria, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollos,aceite,papas y otros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This borrower continues to manage a roasted chicken business.  She has been in business for some time and it has brought her both financial and personal satisfaction.  The borrower is a responsible and diligent individual who wants to continue working so that she can support her family.  

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy chicken, oil, potatoes, and other supplies.  She is pleased with the loan and promised to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy chicken, oil, potatoes, and other supplies.

loans.name: Domitilo

texts.es: Domitilo lleva muchos años dentro del mundo del café. El comenzó a trabajar en esta actividad desde pequeño al lado de su padre, que fue quien le enseñó todos los secretos necesarios para producir café de excelente calidad. Cuando Domitilo formó su familia a la edad de 23 años se independizó y ahora ha transmitido a sus hijos todos sus conocimientos para que ellos también se dediquen a esta actividad. Para la siguiente cosecha Domitilo solicita un crédito que utilizará para pagar a los trabajadores que le ayudarán durante la época de cosecha pues son muchas las actividades que hay que realizar. Este crédito lo pagará al final de la cosecha.
texts.en:
Domitilo has spent many years in the world of coffee.  He began working in this trade at a young age alongside his father, who taught him all the secrets that are necessary for producing coffee of excellent quality.  When Domitilo started his family at the age of 23, he became independent.  He has now passed on all of his knowledge to his children so that they can also get involved in this business.  

In order to proceed with his harvest, Domitilo is requesting a loan so that he can pay the workers who will help him during this season.  There will be many tasks that need to be accomplished.  This loan will be repaid at the end of the harvest.

loans.use: to pay the workers who will help him during the harvest season.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia Luz Marina se sigue dedicanod al negocio de compra y venta de ropa,la socia vende blusas,polos y chompas y tambien se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la ropa.La socia solicita el credito para comprar polos,blusas,chompas y pantalones.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Luz Marina continues to engage in her business of buying and selling clothes.  She sells blouses, pullover shirts, and sweaters.  Luz also continues to manage a business of selling food.  She works from 8:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M.  Luz has already been in business for eight years and is doing very well.  Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell clothes.  

Luz is requesting a loan so that she can buy pullover shirts, blouses, sweaters, and trousers.  She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy pullover shirts, blouses, sweaters, and trousers.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a "tricikad" transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

Lilia requested a 6000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy spare parts to maintain her tricikad transport.

In the future, Lilia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to maintain her tricicad transport

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Dominga; la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de chicha, choclos y golosinas, la socia tiene un puesto donde vende su mercadería a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

 La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz al por mayor.

La socia está agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Dominga continues working in her business selling chicha [a corn-based sweet drink], corncobs, and snacks. She has a stall where she sells her goods to all her customers, who come and seek her out. She has been working at this business for a long time, and it is going well for her, thanks to the hard work that she puts in every day. She is a responsible person, and it is in this way that she takes her family forward.

Dominga is seeking this loan in order to buy corn at wholesale. She is very grateful for the loan, and is committed to making her repayments.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale.

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en: Emmy is a married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 22 years to 28 years. She describes herself to be focused and diligent. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a high-potential area. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more tea to sell. She hopes that in the future, she will live well. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 40,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more tea to sell.

loans.name: Mosa

texts.en:
Mosa is a married woman with three children, who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mosa is 41 years old.

Mosa has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items like pants, blouses, slippers and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Mosa has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more items like pants, blouses, slippers and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 48 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school. Anita works very hard to provide for them.

Anita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, such as soap, milk, canned goods, noodles and eggs.

Anita has been in this business for 24 years.

In the future she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, such as soap, milk, canned goods, noodles and eggs

loans.name: Rael

texts.en: Rael is a 43-year-old married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 14 years to 22 years. She describes herself as focused. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for 16 years. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy farm inputs to grow tea. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 40,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy farm inputs to expand her tea farm.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 53 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Merlyn is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Merlyn has been raising pigs for 13 years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save money to expand her business and repair her house.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a 36 year old and married. She has 7 children with ages ranging from 1 to 16 years. She describes herself to be credible. She operates a restaurant where she sells food and drinks. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a profitable area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inflation of prices. She will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy tables and chairs for use in her restaurant. Her business goal is to become the leading restaurant within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be self reliant. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy tables and chairs for use in her hotel

loans.name: Channy

texts.en: A mother of four kids, Channy is 26 years old and strives for a living via paddy farming and working at construction sites. She has been involved in her current business for 12 years. This is not Channy's first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has paid back her past loan with success to improve her living, especially by providing daily, decent food for her kids. For this cycle, she is seeking a new loan of 2,500,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer for her farmland, to pay for plowing fees, and to buy a decent motorbike to support her business. She hopes to support her business on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland, pay for plowing fees, and buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Maria Hermenia

texts.en:
Maria Hermenia is 52 years old, and a married mother of one kid. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Maria Hermenia has a food production business in the Philippines. Maria Hermenia requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Maria Hermenia has been in this business for two years. In the future, Maria Hermenia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 50 years old, and she works hard to support her family. Emma is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She requests a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional vegetable to sell.

In the future, Emma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetable to sell

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en: Dionesia is a 59 year old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has 3 children and the oldest is 19 years old. She engages in fish vending. Her husband works as a laborer. She sells various fresh fish to earn a living.  Aside from selling fish, she raises hogs to earn more income. She requests a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy pig feed, and more fresh fish to sell. In the future, Dionesia would like to expand both her businesses to continue to send her children to school and have a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy pig feed, and more fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Samyan's Group

texts.en: Samyan is 29 years old and a married mother of three children, two schoolchildren and one small child. She manages three hectares of rice to support her living costs. She has been involved in this current business for 9 years, earning about 28,000 KHR per day. This is not the first loan for Samyan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid back her past loan wisely to upgrade her lifestyle better than before. Now, she leads a group of two to get a new loan. as the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland. She hopes that she can harvest a good yield to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en:
Joyce lives in a house with mud walls, and a dirt floor in Mutiva village in Kipchekwen, Kenya. The community of Mutiva collects their drinking water from an unprotected spring because there is no piped water supply in this part of rural Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Mutiva’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source, where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans, then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from recontamination.  

In Mutiva village, 11 households will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Joyce has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter, responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water and keep themselves and their families healthy.

Mutiva village needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Joyce’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To provide communities with free access to chlorine to treat their drinking water

loans.name: Venessa's Group

texts.en:
Venessa lives with her husband and children in a house with mud walls and a dirt floor in Jepseri A village in Givole, Kenya.

The community of Jepseri A collects their drinking water from a protected spring because there is no piped water supply in this part of rural Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Jepseri A’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source, where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans, then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from recontamination. 

In Jepseri A village, 20 households will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Venessa has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter, responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water and keep themselves and their families healthy.

Jepseri A village needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits.  Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Venessa’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To reduce the burden of water-borne diseases by providing access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers.

loans.name: Henry's Group

texts.en:
In Gavirimoni village in Gasianga, Kenya, Henry has volunteered to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser. Henry is a hardworking and trustworthy member of the community with 4 children; 3 boys and a girl. The eldest is 18 years and the youngest is a girl aged 6 years. He practices dairy and crop farming and has a secondary school certificate.

Gavirimoni village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a protected spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink. 

Henry and the 40 other households using the local water source need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. 

Henry has volunteered to act as the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. He volunteered to be the promoter because he wants his people to access safe water because he hopes it will help the community to prevent waterborne diseases.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits.  Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Henry’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To improve health and productivity by increasing access to safe drinking water through chlorine dispensers.

loans.name: Gulumkan

texts.ru: Гулумкан 32 года, разведена, одна воспитывает троих детей. В 2002 году, начала бизнес в торговле детскими вещами, используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 6,000 сом (KGS). Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Гулумкан имеет среднемесячный доход в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду в бизнесе, Гулумкан смогла увеличить товарооборот и развить свой бизнес. В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Гулумкан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товарооборота. Доходы от кредита Гулумкан планирует вложить в товарооборот и накопить деньги на обучение своих детей.
texts.en: Gulumkan is 32 years old, she is divorced and is raising three children. In 2002 she started her business selling children's clothing using a starting capital in the amount of 6,000 som (KGS). She was able to grow her business and get regular customers which gives her an average monthly income of 15,000 som. Thanks to her hard work Gulumkan was able to increase sales volume and grow her business. With her goal to grow her business further Gulumkan has come to the Microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 30,000 KGS to increase sales. Gulumkan plans to invest the income from the loan into inventory and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing for retail.

loans.name: Sreyma's Group

texts.en:
Sreyma, 27 years old, is a rice farmer from Moung Russey district of Battambang, where she resides, and is blessed with three little kids. She has been involved in the current business for three years and earning about 25,000 KHR per day. Sreyma is now leading a group of four to get a new loan from VisionFund (a Kiva partner). She and her co-borrowers have been with VisionFund for at least seven cycles. 

For Sreyma, she is an eight-time borrower with VisionFund. She has repaid her past loan wisely in order to upgrade her living standards. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland. She hopes to make a good income from her business so she can set aside some money to expand her business for extra income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Marilou works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling personal products. Marilou is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy new engine for her fishing boat.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Ernalyn

texts.en:
Ernalyn is 22 years old and has one child who is in school. She works hard to help her husband generate additional income for her family.

Ernalyn has a tricicad transport business in the Philippines. Ernalyn requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase materials for the maintenance of her tricicad transport.

She has been in this business for four years. In the future, Ernalyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the maintenance of her tricicad transport.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al ngeocio de preparacion de tortas,la socia prepara tortas para eventos como matrimonios,cumpleaños y otros,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local para vender las tortas.La socia solicita le credito para comprar insumos como harina,mantequilla y azucar.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member works making cakes. She makes cakes for events such as weddings, birthdays and more. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 10: p.m. She has done this business for several years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a locale to sell the cakes in. She is asking for this loan to buy ingredients such as flour, butter and sugar. 

She is happy and committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy materials such as flour, butter and sugar.

loans.name: Ubaldina

texts.es:
La socia Ubaldina se sigue dedicando al negocio de restaurant,la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo al horno,sopas y tallarines,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 10 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar insumos para cocinar como pollo,verduras y carne.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is named Ubaldina and she continues to work in the restaurant business. She prepares different dishes such as baked chicken, soups and pastas. She works from 8:00 a.m until 5:00 p.m. She has been on this business for 10 years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her restaurant business. She is asking for the loan to buy ingredients to cook such as chicken, vegetables and beef. 

She is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to cook such as chicken, vegetables and beef.

loans.name: Merlito

texts.en: Merlito is 52 years old and has nine children, some of whom have their own families and live separately. He is now a widower. He has a farming business he has managed for more than 20 years. Sometimes, his children help him in his rice field. He would like to earn a larger income from his farming business but has insufficient funds. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay for the labor costs in farming. He hopes to improve his crop production and someday gain an abundant harvest in order to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay for the labor costs in farming.

loans.name: Sokrat's Group

texts.en: Sokrat is a young, married lady who resides in the Moung Russey district of the Battambang province where she manages her rice-farming agribusiness. She has been involved in her current business for several years now. This is not the first loan for Sokrat with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan wisely to uplift her lifestyle and make it better than before. Now, she is seeking a new loan in order to buy rice seeds and potash for her farmland. She hopes that she can make a good income to sustain her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and potash for her farmland.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
Socorro is 54 years old and married with five children. Socorro works very hard to provide for them.

Socorro runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Socorro has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, sugar, soap, noodles and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future, Socorro would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio Edmundo se sigue dedicando al negocio de pollo brosteria,el socio prepara pollos broster con papas fritas,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene 9 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de restaurant.El socio solicita el credito para comprar pollos y papas para su brosteria.

 El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Edmundo continues with his business selling Broaster-style chicken. He prepares Broasted chickens with fried potatoes. He works from 8:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. and has been in business nine years and does very well. His dream is to expand the Broaster-style chicken shop. He’s asking for the loan to buy chickens and potatoes to cook in his Broaster-style chicken shop. 

He feels grateful for the loan and is committed to making his installment payments on time.

loans.use: To buy chickens and potatoes for his business.

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es: Andrés se ha dedicado al campo durante toda su vida. Aunque sabe producir varios tipos de frutos como el limón, la caña y el maíz; el café ha sido el que mayores beneficios le ha traído, además la zona en la que vive es famosa por la excelente calidad del café. Para esta cosecha Andrés necesita resembrar nuevas plantas y comprar fertilizantes. Para poder llevar a cabo estas acciones Andrés solicita un crédito el cual pagará al final de la cosecha. Además de producir café Andrés y su esposa también cuentan con un negocio en el que venden pollo destazado.
texts.en:
Andrés has been a farmer all his life.  Although he knows how to produce different types of crops such as lemon, sugar cane and corn, coffee has been the one that has given him the greatest profits.  And the area where he lives is famous for the excellent quality of its coffee.

This season Andrés needs to replant his farmland and buy fertilizers.  In order to do this Andrés is requesting a loan to make payment at the after the harvest.  Apart from producing coffee, Andrés and his wife also sell butchered chicken.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and replant his farm.

loans.name: Rina Elena

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de artesania,la socia vende chompas,carteras y chuyos,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de artesania.La socia solicita el credito para comprar chuyos,carteras y chompas.

La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower continues in her craft business, selling sweaters, purses and hats.  She works from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m., has been in business several years; and things are going well for her.  Her goal is to expand her business.  She is requesting a loan to buy hats, purses and sweaters.

The borrower is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy hats, purses and sweaters.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es  productora de leche el cual  entrega a una empresa de acopio,  vive en casa propia junto a su familia en la comunidad de Ticuyo del municipio de Laja a dos   horas de viaje de la ciudad de La Paz, cuenta con  algunas cabezas de ganado  las cuales le proporcionan leche, la que diariamente entrega al recolector. Sus cuatro hijos mayores se encuentran en edad escolar, razón por la cual requieren mayores recursos para solventar sus gastos, por ello su esposo Basilio tiene que trabajar como albañil en su comunidad.
.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar una vaca lechera y asi incrementar su producción

El sueño de Isabel es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado.
texts.en:
Isabel produces milk which she sells to a collection company.  She lives in her own house with her family in the community of Ticuyo in the municipality of Laja, which is two hours' distance from the city of La Paz.  She has several heads of cattle which provide the milk that she delivers daily.  Her four children attend school so she wants more income to cover their expenses.  Her husband, Basilio, works as a bricklayer in the community.

The loan she is requesting is to buy a dairy cow to increase production.

Isabel's dream is to have increase her livestock.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Uuljan

texts.ru: Уулжан 38 лет, разведена, одна воспитывает двоих детей (1 дочь, 1 сын). В 2002 году, начала бизнес в торговле детскими вещами, используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 8,000 сом (KGS). Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Уулжан имеет среднемесячный доход в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду в бизнесе, Уулжан смогла увеличить товарооборот и развить свой бизнес. В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Уулжан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товарооборота. Доходы от кредита Уулжан планирует вложить в товарооборот и накопить деньги на обучение своих детей.
texts.en: Uuljan is 38 years old, she is divorced and is raising two children (one son and one daughter). In 2002 she has started her busienss selling children's clothing using a starting capital in the amount of 8,000 som (KGS). She was able to grow her business and get regular customers which gives her an average monthly income of 15,000 som. Thanks to her hard work Uuljan was able to increase sales volume and grow her business. With her goal to grow her business further Uuljan has come to the Microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 10,000 KGS to increase sales. Uuljan plans to invest the income from the loan into inventory and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing for retail.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa de Jesús mayor de edad acompañada con tres hijos menores de edad bajo su responsabilidad originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega zona donde predomina el comercio, la caña y la azúcar, Teresa es una micro empresaria que se dedica a le venta de mercadería en general como ropa nueva variada, así como también el cosmético: maquillajes, cremas, perfumenes, shampoo, pinturas de uñas entre otros, sus compras las realiza al contado en algunos mercados de mayoreo y distribuidores, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito los cuales recupera quincenalmente, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, inicia su negocio impulsada por sus cuñadas que ya conocían el negocio ahora ella tiene 8 años de trabajar en esto de manera ambulante, uno de sus sueños es mejorar su vivienda y así ofrecerles un techo digno donde vivir a sus hijos al igual que verlos ya realizados con una carrera siendo profesionales e incrementar mas su negocio. Teresa solicita financiamiento para compra de mercadería en general y cosméticos como: variedades de ropa tanto para niño como adulto al igual que cosméticos debido a que se aproximan las fiestas patrias y ha crecido su demanda de productos.-
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús lives with her three minor children.  She is from one of the muncipalities of Chinandega, an area known for its commerce of sugar cane and sugar.  Teresa has a small business selling general merchandise such as new clothing and cosmetics: makeup, creams, perfumes, shampoo, nail polish, etc.  She buys her products at wholesale markets and from distributors.  She sells them on both a cash and credit basis, collecting payments every two weeks.  She has both permanent and eventual customers.  

Her sisters-in-law were the ones who encouraged her to get started because they were familiar with the business.  She has been working as a street vendor now for eight years.  One of her goals is to renovate her home so her children will have a decent roof over their heads.  She wants them to get professional training and wants her business to grow.

Teresa is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise such as a variety of children's and adult's clothing.  She will also buy cosmetics because the patron saint celebrations are approaching and market demand is up.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Rahim

texts.ru: Рахим житель города Куляб. Ему 33 года. Он женат и имеет одну дочь и одного сына. Кроме жены и детей с ним живут его родители, которых надо кормить. Рахим целеустремленный и трудолюбивый человек. У него большой водительский стаж, но в данный момент он нигде не работает. Рахим решился стать таксистом, он планирует возить пассажиров по трассе Куляб-Душанбе. Но только у Рахима нет машины. В связи с финансовыми трудностями его семья не может позволить себе машину. Таким образом, он запрашивает в кредит недостающую сумму 700$ для покупки автомобиля марки «Opel». Благодаря кредиту он сможет начать зарабатывать и обеспечивать свою семью.
texts.en: Rahim is a resident of the town of Kulob. He is 33 years old. He is married and has one daughter and one son.  Besides his wife and children his parents who need support also live with him. Rahim is a purposeful and hardworking man. He has a long driving experience, but is not working at this time. Rahim decided to become a taxi driver, he plans to transport passengers on the road from Kulob to Dushanbe, but he does not have a car at this time. Because of the financial difficulties his family cannot afford a car. So he is asking for the remaining $700 to buy a car by make of Opel. Because of the loan he can start earning money and support his family.

loans.use: to buy a car by make of Opel to start work.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлуде 19 лет. Она порядочная и добродушная девушка. Мавлуда с детства всегда мечтала стать учительницей. Она успешно училась в средней школе и активно участвовала во всех мероприятиях школы. После окончания средней школы она поступила в Педагогический Университет Таджикистана. Данное время она является одной из лучших студентов 2 курса. Мать Мавлуды работает в государственном учреждении. Она основная кормилица в семье. Мать Мавлуды имеет маленькую зарплату и не в состоянии оплатить за учебный договор Мавлуды в университете. Мавлуда запрашивает займ на сумму 900 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Mavluda is 19 years old. She is a decent and kind young woman. Mavluda has been dreaming to become a teacher since she was little. She has successfully studied in secondary school and actively participated in all of school's events. After graduating from school she enrolled in a Pedagogical University of Tajikistan. Right now she is one of the best students in the sophomore year. Mavluda's mother works in a government institution and is the main supporter of the family. Mavluda's mother receives a small salary and is not able to pay for Mavluda's tuition in the university. Mavluda is asking for a loan in the amount of $900 to pay for tuition. She is waiting for your generosity and hoping for your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for education.

loans.name: Rakhnaza

texts.en:
Rakhnaza is a student of AUCA and below is her story:

My name is Rakhnaza. I have graduated the Educational Complex Gymnasium No20 this year. I had excellent marks in all school subjects and actively participated in social life of my school. 

This year, I enrolled the American University of Central Asia. To become part of AUCA was the main goal of my life.
 
As I was really active in social life of my school, I believe that this experience will much help me to be an active participant of social life at the American University of Central Asia. The activities I was involved in were: volunteering in different events devoted to corruption, unemployment, AIDs control, etc. 

I also took an active part in Olympiads in such subjects as: Chemistry, Economics and Physics. However, my family cannot afford to cover the full tuition at AUCA. Therefore, I would like to take an opportunity and apply for financial support to Kiva.
 
I hope all the above mentioned experience will make it easy to be a student of such a prestigious University as AUCA.

loans.use: to pay for higher education.

loans.name: Fearly

texts.en:
Fearly is 36 years old and married with three children.

Fearly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, milk, soap, spices, etc..

She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from a bakery.

Fearly aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, milk, soap and spices.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 62 years old and married.

Mildred is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Mildred requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers, pesticides and other farm supplies.

Mildred has been farming rice for nine years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch, 41, is a married mother residing in a rural village located in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has nine children, three of whom are still in school. She has been planting cassava on four hectares for ages as her main source of income. She can earn about 38,800 KHR per day which she uses to meet the family’s needs. 

Touch is a client in her fifth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). The previous loan, that she has completely repaid, has helped her to have a decent house and to provide a good food for her family. Now she is seeking a new loan of 4,000,000 KHR to pay the weeding fee for her cassava crop. She hopes this loan will enable her to support her business in a timely manner and increase the family's income so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To pay the weeding fee for her cassava crop.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Guldastan

texts.en:
Guldastan is a student of AUCA and below is her story:

My name is Guldastan. I have graduated high school this year and enrolled in the American University of Central Asia as it is one of the best universities in Central Asia. AUCA gives students excellent opportunities both in studies and extracurricular activities. I think about all the opportunities within all other universities of Kyrgyzstan, but AUCA's prestige prevails over all the others. I will have lots of opportunities both during studies and after. The potential of tutors and all the resources available for studies at AUCA attracts almost everyone to apply there. 

I live in a family of six: my parents, three siblings and myself. My parents both work, but my brother goes to school and my little sister goes to a kindergarten, which also has some expenses. Therefore my parents are not able to cover my tuition fees fully. I am applying for a Kiva loan which will help me to cover my tuition fees. I think this is another unique opportunity that AUCA gives to its students. 

I think it is quite hard to study at the American University of Central Asia and only hardworking, responsible and intelligent students can handle it. But I have made myself ready as I have to achieve my goals, so education at AUCA will give me an opportunity to make it happen.

loans.use: To pay for higher education.

loans.name: Asel

texts.en:
Asel is a student at AUCA.  This is her story:

My name is Asel. I live in a family of five: my parents, two siblings and myself. My father had his own business, but due to some problems, he closed it. My mother is pursuing her second higher education degree at Bishkek Medical College and also works there, in a part-time job. Now we also have a loan, which was taken to buy a house for us.

All the above-mentioned made it necessary for me to apply for financial aid, to be able to get quality education at the American University of Central Asia. I plan to become a professional in the field of Business Administration. To study at AUCA is one of my dreams, and I hope I will be lucky enough to get funded. For this reason I am applying for a KIVA loan, so that it would be easier to cover my tuition at AUCA.

I will do my best to be a role model student of AUCA and play an active role in AUCA social life. The knowledge that I will get at AUCA will definitely give me a chance to make a significant contribution to the development of my region and my entire country.

loans.use: To pay higher education tuition and pursue a degree in Business Administration.

loans.name: Saknat

texts.en:
Saknat is aged 30 and is married with three children; one is still in school while another two are too young for school. She lives in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district. She makes a living through growing cassava and rubber trees. She has been in this business for almost 12 years and it gives her returns of about 32,100 KHR per day to support her family and their daily expenses. 

Saknat has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. Now she is seeking a loan of 2,000,000 KHR in order to pay for cassava plants. She will also use a portion of the loan to buy rubber for planting. She expects to get a higher crop yield and hence to get an increased income to support her family's needs.

loans.use: To pay for cassava plants.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Savoeurt's Group

texts.en:
Savoeurt, 31, is a mother of two children who are too young for school. She is residing in a rural village in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. To make a living, she has been farming rice and working for others for a fee for 10 years. She can earn about 19,000 KHR per day. 

This is the sixth loan cycle with VisionFund for Savoeurt. The previous loan, which she has completely repaid, has helped her to provide decent food for her family. Now she leads a group of three members to applying for a new loan. As the leader, she will use her loan portion to pay a plowing fee and buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to gain a high yield so as she can make more income to upgrade her lifestyle and keep her kids in school in future.

loans.use: To pay a plowing fee and buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria works hard to support her family. Gloria is married and has a business selling young coconuts in the Philippines.

Gloria requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more young coconuts to sell.

Gloria has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more young coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Kanykei

texts.en:
Kanykei is a student at AUCA.  This is her story:

My name is Kanykei. I graduated from high school this year and enrolled in the university of my dream – American University of Central Asia. 
I am looking for financial aid on Kiva's website to be able to cover part of my tuition fees. 

The main problem of the young generation in getting higher education is lack of resources. And it is not only in Kyrgyzstan; it is all over the world. Millions of smart brains stay in the shade, and only some of them can reach to the light. Unfortunately, not many of us were lucky to be born into a family which can afford a high level of life style. In fact, statistically teenagers from poor families can reach many more achievements because they were taught to survive hardship since they were kids. If they get an opportunity, they do a lot to make it happen. 

I have chosen the American University of Central Asia so I can best apply the knowledge that I have gained so far. I was born to be a leader. The fact that I am the president of our class increases my chance of studying in such a university. I am a debater and experienced that during the last year. I also take part at Tech Age Girls program under IREX. This program gave me a lot of basic knowledge in IT resources. I also became more independent and democratic.  Thus, I would surely say that I could contribute a lot to the social life of the University as well.

The only problem is that my family is not able to pay the whole amount of the tuition fees, which is the reason that I am applying for a Kiva loan. 
I hope that I will get such an opportunity and I am ready for the challenge of a new environment. I am ready to devote myself to studies and to the social life of the AUCA. It is my firm belief that I can make a huge contribution to the economy of Kyrgyzstan.

loans.use: to pay for higher education.

loans.name: Zhamilia

texts.en:
Zhamilia is a student at the American University of Central Asia (AUCA). This is her story:

My name is Zhamilia. I have graduated from high school this year and enrolled at the American University of Central Asia. I am applying for a Kiva loan to be able to cover my tuition fees. A Kiva loan gives an opportunity to people like me to pursue education at AUCA or other Universities. Lack of money impedes the process of education since you start thinking only about the money you have to pay; consequently, problems in studies occur. It is hard for my parents to cover tuition fees for three children and I would therefore like to take the opportunity that AUCA gives to its students and apply for a Kiva loan.  

Since I was in ninth grade, I have dreamed about entering the best University not only in Kyrgyzstan, but in all of Central Asia. So, I have chosen AUCA because its unique features will guarantee me an opportunity to reach my learning goals. Also, educational instruction is given in English. From childhood, I have always liked this language and the chance to study in English would be magnificent. I have a keen interest in studying Journalism and Mass Communications because I have a big interest in photography and writing. I realized what field I wanted to study last year and had an immense desire to become part of JMC department at AUCA, and my dream came true.

AUCA gives the best education in Central Asia. I will be able to help not only my family, but also my country while becoming a good specialist of the area that I have chosen. I am very enthusiastic about volunteering, which became an excitement when I first did community service in the USA. Comparing my country to others, I see that our economics are so weak and I would like to bring a change and give better conditions to my descendants. 
I will highly appreciate your assistance and want you to believe in my abilities because I always try my best in everything.

loans.use: to pay for higher education.

loans.name: Anastasiia

texts.en:
Anastasia is a student at the American University of Central Asia (AUCA). This is her story:

My name is Anastasia. It is my dream to study at AUCA, in the Journalism and Mass Communication Department. I enrolled in the AUCA Department of JMC this year and feel very excited about that. Attending the university in this program is the first step towards my future career as a reporter. I have dreamt of being in the field of Journalism since I saw TV news for the first time. AUCA is the best place to get higher education in the area of Mass Media because of the high quality of education and it is a chance to meet and interact with people from all over the world. 

I have always maintained excellent records whether it is academic activities in school or some competitions. Sports taught me not to give up, but I am quite confused about my expectations because of financial matters. So I would like to apply for financial support to AUCA.

I am applying for a Kiva loan as my family cannot afford to fully cover the tuition fees. We have thought about AUCA since the first time we heard about it from our acquaintance. My parents saved money for my future education. Time has elapsed but our funds are not very big because of appropriate outcomes. Our family consists of four people: my parents, grandmother, and I. Only my mother has a permanent job but it is not a full time job, and the income varies. My father is a seasonal worker, so his income depends on certain seasons. I am a schoolgirl.  I could earn extra money, but this way I would have less time for studies and would not keep up with my class. All I can do now is to get good knowledge that will help me in my future. 

I will take part in all AUCA extracurricular activities with alacrity in which my participation can contribute to something useful for the university.

loans.use: to pay for higher education.

loans.name: Saltanat

texts.en:
Saltanat graduated from one of Bishkek's schools and enrolled in the American University of Central Asia, department of Business Administration, this year. AUCA has been her dream university for a long time. 

Saltatnat lives in a family of six: her parents and three siblings. Her mother and one of her brothers work; their salaries are spent for the household needs, and also for the secondary school fees of the siblings. Her family can’t afford paying the tuition fees fully, therefore, she is applying for a Kiva loan to partially cover her tuition.
 
During her studies, Saltanat has been very active in extracurricular activities, such as dancing, organizing different events and taking an active role in the social life of her school. She attended dancing classes for five years, and together with her group, made performances on a few TV channels. She also was a show-man in the school festival of nation’s friendship on Nooruz (a national holiday).
 
The above mentioned experience and knowledge give Saltanat a confidence in her future studies. She hopes to bring new experience to the social life of AUCA, as well as gain new experience and knowledge herself.

AUCA gives a very good opportunity to all its students, as do loans for studies through Kiva. Saltanat takes this opportunity to apply for a Kiva loan, too, as it will help her to cover her tuition.

loans.use: To pay for higher education.

loans.name: Than's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Kandal Province’s Sa Ang district, Than is 52 years old and a widowed mother of six children. Growing rice and cabbage is a main source of income for her family and allows them to cover their daily expenses. She has been engaged in this business for 30 years. 

Than has never been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, before. Now she is forming a group consisting of two people to apply for a loan of 170,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she is going to spend her loan portion to buy materials to construct a latrine for her family including cement, bricks, a toilet bowl, etc... 

She hopes that this loan will enable her to provide a decent latrine so her family members can live in high sanitation.

loans.use: To buy materials to construct a latrine.

loans.name: Rom

texts.en:
Rom is 44 years old and a mother of six children. Nowadays, she strives for a living via maize farming. This is the business that she has had for ages and it brings her about 15,000 KHR per day. 

This is not the first loan for Rom with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). She has repaid back her past loan wisely and has improved her living standards so they are better than before. Now, she is getting a new loan in order to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a good yield from her agribusiness and make more income.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Crisales

texts.en:
This is Crisales. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts, accessories and y for the maintenance of their jeepney unit. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of their jeepney unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Crisales hopes to have another unit of jeepney and dreams that her children will finish their studies. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work. At the meetings, she can also draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

Footnote: Interestingly, jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly the Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and make their microfinance loan repayments.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio is a farmer from Alcala. He lives with his children and wife. They rely on planting and harvesting rice for an income to support their immediate needs. He patiently manages a hectare of rice field. He makes about PHP 20,000 average net income twice a year (during the harvest). 

He wanted to improve his crop production but had insufficient funds. That is why he is asking for a loan to invest in his farming business. He will buy fertilizers and pay for the labor cost of planting rice seeds. Someday, he hopes to become a successful rice grower and will give a better life to his family.

loans.use: to invest in his farming business by buying inputs like fertilizers.

loans.name: Ren's Group

texts.en: Ren, aged 54, is married and a mother of five children. Nowadays, she has two children in school. For the sake of her family, she sells fish. Her husband also helps to supplement her income by working as a house builder; her husband is also a fisherman. This is the business that she has had for 10 years. This is Ren's third loan and the first for her co-borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loans with success and it has enabled her to support her living and keep her kids in school. Now, she forms a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan to buy lacquer for her husband's boat and to fix boat’s engine. She hopes that this purchase will support her need on time and make more income.

loans.use: To buy lacquer for her husband's boat and to fix boat’s engine for his fishing business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina y su esposo Baltazar se dedican a la producción de café desde hace muchos años. En su casa cuentan con un vivero de planta de café pues para ellos es muy importante que su producto sea de la mejor calidad así que se involucran lo más que pueden en el proceso. Para esta cosecha Marina resembro parte de su finca con nueva planta, pues la que tenían ya había cumplido s ciclo de vida productivo y necesitaba ser reemplazada. Para que esta planta de buenos frutos dentro de unos años es necesario fertilizarla y por eso necesita de un crédito. Marina y su esposo también tienen en su casa una tienda de abarrotes para así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Marina and her husband Baltazar have made a living from growing coffee for many years. In her house they have a nursery with coffee plants because it is very important to them that their product is of the highest quality so they get as involved as they can in the process.

For this harvest Marina reseeds part of her plantation with new plants, as those she already had have reached the end of their production life cycle and need to be replaced. In order for the plant to give good fruit within a few years it needs to be fertilized and this is why she needs a loan. Marina and her husband also have a grocery store in their house in order to increase their income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Vilma De Los Santos

texts.es: Vilma de los Santos mayor de edad soltera originaria de una de las comarcas del municipio de chinandega, vilma es trabajadora activa del ministerio de educacion como docente en una de las comarcas de este municipio, ella es cliente de leon 2000 con varios creditos ya los cuales ha cumplido en tiempo y forma, ahora esta solicitando nuevamente para realizar ciertas mejoras en su hogar como embaldosar y repellar algunas paredes de la sala y cuarto, desde hace seis años ella ha venido realizandole mejoras a su vivienda pero aun no termina, uno de sus sueños es poder ver terminada su vivienda mas ahora con estas lluvias, Vilma solicita financiamiento para la compra de materiales de construccion como: cemento, bloques, cal, piedrin, arena, mano de obra entre otros. agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos economicos.-
texts.en:
Vilma de los Santos is a single adult from one of the regions of the municipality of Chinandega. Vilma works for the Ministry of Education as a teacher in one of the regions of this municipality. 

She is a client of Leon 2000 with various loans which she has repaid correctly and on time. She is now applying for a new loan to make certain improvements to her home such as tiling and plastering some of the walls in the living room and bedroom. She has been making improvements to her home for the last six years but is not yet finished. 

One of her dreams is to be able to finish her home, especially now with the current rainfall. Vilma is asking for a loan to buy construction materials such as: cement, blocks, lime, gravel, sand and labour amongst other things. She is very grateful for the support investors give to people with low incomes.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as lime, sand, gravel, blocks and cement amongst other things

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Nena works hard to support her family. She has a pottery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Nena is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her pottery business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her pottery business.

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en: Ly is in her early 50s and is a married mother of six children. Her main sources of income are from pig-raising and paddy rice farming. She has been involved in this business for just two years, earning about 36,000 KHR per day. This is not the first loan for Ly with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) as she and her co-borrowers are fifth-time borrowers including this cycle. She has fully repaid her previous loans wisely. She managed to upgrade her lifestyle to better than before. Now, she is seeking for 200,000 KHR while her joint borrower is applying for 1,400,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her rice farming business. She hopes to gain a good yield from her cash-crop.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice farming business.

loans.name: Savoeurt's Group

texts.en: Savoeurt is a 53-year-old mother of eight children. Nowadays only three kids still rely on her as they are still in school. She has involved in this business for 10 years and it has returned her about 19,000 KHR per day. This is the original loan for Savoeurt with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She forms a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crops. She hopes to gain a good yield from her current business so she can upgrade her living standards.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Rice farming has been Mario's business for many years. He lives with his family in Alcala where he plants and harvests rice. He is now 59 years old. He is still strong in managing his business. He usually gets an average net income of PHP 20,000 each harvest season, twice a year. He would like to improve the nutrition of his crops and that is why he is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, herbicides and pay for labor costs spent on farming. This will help improve his production. 

Mario has promised to pay back the loan after harvest and that additional revenue that will be generated will be saved to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides and pay for labor costs spent on farming.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is 25 years old and married with two children. Lourdes works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell such as canned goods, milk, soap, sugar, etc. Lourdes has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough to money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell such as canned goods, milk, soap, sugar, etc. for her general store.

loans.name: Ngi's Group

texts.en: Ngi is a mother of six children in her mid-50s. She is a resident of Battambang Province’s Sangke District. She raises chickens and sells desserts to earn the daily costs of living and sustain her family. Her husband helps support her via working as a schoolteacher. She has been involved in her current business for two years, and it has returned to her about 34,000 riels per day. This is the first microloan for Ngi with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In her group of two, she is the leader. Ngi will spend her loan portion to buy more chickens to raise and more ingredients for making sweets to sell. She hopes to double her income to upgrade her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy more chickens to raise

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is 54 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like soap, sugar, coffee, milk, etc.. Lita has been in this business for six years.

In the future Lita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like soap, sugar, coffee, milk, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase carpentry tools such as a saw and sharpening steel.

loans.name: Khoeurt's Group

texts.en:
Khoeurt is 46 years old and a villager from Sangke district of Battambang province. She has three children. For the sake of her family, she raises chickens at home while her husband works at a construction site. Engaged in her current business for 10 years, she is able to earn up to 15,800 KHR per day. 

Khoeurt is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner); that's the same cycle as her co-borrower in the group of two. This cycle, she and her fellow group member are applying for 1,000,000 KHR each. She will spend her loan portion to buy more chickens for raising and to buy necessary materials to support her husband's occupation. She hopes to gain a good income from her chickens.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for raising

loans.name: Rom's Group

texts.en: Residing in Sangke district of Battambang province, Rom is 54 years old and has six children. Her main source of income is from rice farming. This is the business that she has had for ages. Rom has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. Now, she is leading a group of two to get a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. She will spend her loan portion to  buy fertilizer, rice seed, and to pay for plowing.  She hopes that she can gain a good yield from her crop and make a good income to support her family.

loans.use: To  buy fertilizer, rice seed, and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Yeang's Group

texts.en: Yeang is 60 years old and a local farmer from Battambang province’s Sangke district. She is a mother of five children. She and her husband grow rice as their main source of income. She has been involved in her current business for 20 years, earning about 10,000 KHR per day. This is the first loan for Yeang with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).   She is seeking 200,000 KHR whereas her joint borrower is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. She will spend her loan portion to buy two sacks of fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that she can make a good income from her crop and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Faroukou

texts.fr: Revendeur de viande de bœuf et chèvre au marché, Faroukou pour satisfaire ses clients sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES. Il est aidé par 01 personne et désire à l'avenir devenir un grossiste et subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Âgée de 26ans, il est marié et n'a pas d'enfants en charge pour l'instant.
texts.en: A seller of beef and goat meat at the market, Faroukou is requesting a first loan from WAGES so that he can satisfy his customers' needs. He is helped by one person and in future he would like to become a wholesaler and be able to support his family. At 26 years old, he is married but has no children for the moment.

loans.use: to buy beef and goat meat to sell

loans.name: Soum

texts.en:
Soum is 31 years old and the mother of three dependent children.  Two of the children are in school and one is younger. She overcomes her family's financial burden through rice and cassava farming. The current business earns her about 37,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first microloan for Soum with VisionFund. She is requesting a new loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy rice seed, fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland. She hopes that she can improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Angella

texts.en:
Angella runs a boutique business in Makueni town where she sells clothes, shoes, and handbags, among other boutique items. She is 24 years old and single. She has been in this business for the past six months.

This being her first loan term with KADET LTD, she plans to use the loan to buy an additional stock of clothes and shoes to sell. This will enable her to satisfy the needs of her customers, as well as generate more income.

In the future, Angella hopes to grow her boutique business by stocking it and selling more varieties of wholesale clothes and shoes, and becoming financially stable.

loans.use: To add stock of clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann works hard to support her family; she has a tricicad transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

Mary Ann requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance of her tricicad.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her tricicad

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
Sherly is 56 years old and married with one kid.

Sherly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Sherly has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from food vending.

Sherly aspires to save money to expand her business and improve her house.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 33 years old and a single mother of three children. She runs a green grocery shop and has been in the business for three years making a monthly income of 7,000 Kenya Shillings. 

She will use the loan to buy more vegetables to sell in her business. She will also buy potatoes, carrots, tomatoes and fruits.

This is her first loan with KADET Ltd. and she anticipates to make more profits with which she will buy a plot of land. 

Grace's future hopes and dreams are to be a great supplier of horticultural products and also to start another business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is a very hardworking woman who lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Sidi operates a cafe business where she makes various food like beans, rice, tea, and chapatti (flat bread) to sell to passersby and neighbours. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase food items, tea leaves, maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans. 

She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase food items, tea leaves, maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans.

loans.name: Sandra Marcela

texts.es: Todo  comenzó hace 24 años, cuando en Jamundí Valle  Sandra quiso emprender su propio camino sola sin ayuda de sus padres, de esta manera viaja a otro lugar donde allí conoce a un joven formaron una relación y de esa relación nació un hermoso bebe, pero la felicidad duro poco  porque al poco  tiempo aquello que ella creía hermoso y bello termino, y fue así que entonces se decidió  volver con su familia, pero al encontrarse allí radicada se le presento un problema por ser zona de alta violencia fue amenazada por un grupo armado entonces se encontró con una gran encrucijada y de esta    manera se decide a viajar  a una ciudad fría y donde prácticamente no conocía a nadie, pero llena de oportunidades así que  decide iniciar desde cero y lo hace comenzando por terminar sus estudios y comienza a estudiar enfermería lo que más le gusta en una institución donde le brinda oportunidad de poder hacer su gran sueño realidad, aunque a veces le falte el presupuesto necesario para poder continuar con este, pero ella es fuerte e insiste en hacer lo que más le gusta.
texts.en:
Everthing began in Jamundí Vallen at the age of 24 when Sandra started out on her own without the help of her parents.  She traveled to another place and started a relationship with a young man.  As a result, a beautiful baby was born.  However, her happiness was short-lived because everything she believed to be beautiful and lovely suddenly ended.  

At that point, she decided to return to her family but moving back home would be problematic since they lived in an area with a high level of violence.  On the way back, she ran into an armed group and decided to head toward a cold city where she practically knew no one.  Yet there were still opportunities to start from scratch, so she decided to finish her studies and pursue nursing.  What she enjoys most about CampoAlto is having the opportunity to make her dream a reality.  Sometimes she lacks the necessary funding to continue toward her goal, but she is strong and insists on doing what she likes to do most.

loans.use: to pay for her studies at CampoAlto.

loans.name: Andrea Del Pilar

texts.es:
Andrea es una mujer que quiere estudiar servicios farmacéuticos para ampliar sus conocimientos y de esta manera ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su familia. Por este motivo quiere depositar su confianza en una excelente institución  y a su vez  motivar a las personas a cambiar su estilo de vida a través de su fácil acceso a la educación.
Ingresó  en el programa de auxiliar en servicios farmacéuticos ya que su principal objetivo en el momento de desempeñarse laboralmente es brindar los más altos estándares de calidad en sus servicios y  formarse como una persona con gran liderazgo, critica y ética y de esta manera poder organizarse y  poder crear su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Andrea is a woman who wants to study pharmaceutical services to expand her knowledge, and in this way, offer her family a better future.  For this reason, she wants to place her trust in an excellent institution and at the same time motivate people to change their lifestyle through easy access to education.

She joined the pharmacy assistant program, since her primary objective in her professional development is to bring the highest standards for quality in her services and to get trained as a person with great leadership, acclaim and ethics.  In this way, she would like to get organized and create her own business.

loans.use: to pay for her education at CampoAlto.

loans.name: Rufino

texts.en:
Rufino is 47 years old, married to Cely and they are blessed with three children. The family lives in Alcala. They plant and harvest rice to sell as source of income. He usually gets an average net income of PHP 15,000 per crop and this is very helpful in sustaining their needs. 

Rufino is now taking a loan to invest in developing his crop output. He will buy fertilizers and insecticides for his farm. This will help improve his crop growth and nutrition. He will pay back this loan in full if it will be granted and will continue striving hard for the development of his business and overall welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for his farm.

loans.name: Rebenia

texts.en:
Rebenia is a 48-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is the mother of six children. The oldest child is 25 while the youngest is seven. She raises and sells hogs. She has been raising hogs for quite some period of time.

Rebenia lacks funds to sustain her hog-raising activity. She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy pig feed so the pigs will grow healthy and strong. In the future, Rebenia would like to build a piggery and also gain a steady source of income.

loans.use: to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 47-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has six children. The youngest is eight. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various goods including beverages, noodles, biscuits, sugar, canned goods, shampoo and detergents. 

To fill her store with stock, she requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy more supplies like beverages, noodles, canned goods, toiletries and dry goods. In the future, Rubina would like to become successful entrepreneur and also support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more supplies like beverages, noodles, canned goods, toiletries and dry goods.

loans.name: Roselanie

texts.en: Roselanie is borrowing a new loan of 15,000 PHP to buy fishing gear and other equipment.  She had a prior loan for her fishing business through Kiva's partner NWTF. The fishing business continues to provide Roselanie and her family with the opportunity to increase their income and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Sernalin

texts.en:
Sernalin is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling salt in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock to sell.

Sernalin successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Sernalin's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of salt to sell.

loans.name: Kufuna

texts.en:
Kufuna is a businesswoman who is very hardworking.  She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Kufuna has operated a charcoal selling business for the past two years; her potential clients are neighbours and passersby. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase 20 sacks of charcoal to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase twenty sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es: Desde que se casó hace 10 años Porfirio se ha dedicado de lleno a la producción de café. Aunque ya había aprendido todo lo necesario al lado de su padre quien también se dedica a esta actividad. Para esta cosecha Porfirio sembró nueva planta de café en su finca con la finalidad de aumentar en 3 años su producción, sin embargo necesita realizar algunas labores de limpieza en sus terrenos y para eso solicita un crédito. Además de dedicarse al café Porfirio y su familia se dedican a la producción limón para tener un ingreso extra.
texts.en: Since his marriage ten years ago, Porfirio has made coffee production his main business. He learned everything he needed to know from his father, who is also engaged in this activity. For this year's harvest, Porfirio planted new coffee plants on his property, with the aim of increasing his production within the next three years. Nevertheless, he needs to weed and remove trees from his field, a task for which he asks for a loan. Porfirio and his family also grow lemons in order to earn some extra money.

loans.use: to weed and remove trees from his field.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
