The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is so affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for use in rice production

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean De Dieu is a 42-year-old married father of five children, all of whom attend school. With the loan, he would like to buy more fertilizers to improve his rice production. The profits from the produce will be reinvested in rice farming for future benefits.  


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers to improve rice production

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es: Ana de 31 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora, honesta y responsable con su trabajo y su hogar, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado que está cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela pues sus productos son frescos y a buen precio, es madres soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo de 8 años de edad quien estudia actualmente,  Ana está solicitando un crédito para la compra  de frutas y verduras por mayor para seguir con su negocio y poder  darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana, 31 years old, is a very responsible, honest and hardworking woman in both her business and her home. She sells fruit and vegetables at a market near her residence. She has many customers since her products are fresh and affordable. She is a single mother who lives in a house she owns with her 8 year old son who is in school.

Ana is applying for a loan to purchase fruit and vegetables wholesale in order to maintain her business so that she can give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, potatoes, strawberries, plums, peaches, etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Martha, se dedica arduamente a laborar como maestra de educación primaria  en un pequeño colegio del municipio, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace 25 años, es casada con dos hijos a su cargo, a los que les tiene que proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen.
Una de las necesidades que la señora Martha atraviesa hoy en día es de terminar de cancelar un  lote, para luego construir su vivienda, por lo  ha tomado la sabia decisión  de invertir para mejorar su vida,  Es por este motivo que  acude a Ceprodel   para solicitar un crédito para poderterminar cancelar dicho  lote de terreno.
Es importante destacar que por medio de esta obra le va ir dando mejor estabilidad  y condiciones a su familia.
texts.en:
Martha works hard as a primary school teacher in a small school in her town.  She has done this work for 25 years.  She is married and has two children in her care.  She has to provide them with the necessary conditions for their development.  

One of Martha's needs is to finish paying for a plot of land where she will later build her house.  She has made the wise decision to invest in improving her life.  This is why she came to Ceprodel to request a loan to be able to finish paying off this piece of land.

It is important to note that this will give her and her family more stability and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to finish paying off her land.

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona is 46 years old. She lives in the small village of Tskaltubo district with her husband, two children, and mother-in-law. Her children go to a local secondary school and her mother-in-law is provided with a retirement pension. Her husband Emzar works at a local restaurant and gets a small monthly income. Nona is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she has two milking cows and a calf. She milks the cows every day and produces dairy products for selling. 

As the income is not enough for the family, Nona decided to start her own business with the loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Nona’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she was unable to satisfy their requirements. She received the credit in the framework of the joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With the loan of 2,000 USD she will build a greenhouse. She has a plot of land where the greenhouse will be located. As the greenhouse is built, she will grow tomatoes and greens there. Nona will sell the harvested products and increase the income of her family.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es: La señora Karla es una de esas personas, además de ser Maestra de educación primaria de un colegio de la localidad, también  aprovecha las condiciones Rurales donde habita para emprender otra actividad  como es la crianza de cerdos, por tal Razón  decidió visitar las oficinas de ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un financiamiento y poder lograr el objetivo percibido, dicho crédito lo utilizara en la compra de  cerdos de desarrollo a los que le dará su debido seguimiento, ya que para la época de vacaciones estudiantiles ella aprovecha el tiempo dedicándoselos a la crianza misma, esta señora convive con su marido en union libre no son casados, han procreado  3 hijos a los que les está brindando todo el apoyo para el desarrollo académico, su marido viaja a Costa Rica a vender cerámica de Barro fabricadas en la misma zona donde viven, todos estos esfuerzos son encaminados al mejoramiento de las condiciones y nivel de vida  familiar.
texts.en:
Karla's one of those people: In addition to teaching elementary school in her town, she also makes the most of the rural environment where she lives to do another job raising pigs.

This is why she decided to visit the offices of CEPRODEL to get a loan and be able to achieve her objective.  She'll use this loan to buy pigs to raise.  She'll give them the attention they need, because during the vacation from school she makes the most of her time to devote herself to raising the pigs.

She lives with her partner but is not married.  They have three children, whose academic development she supports completely.  Her partner goes to Costa Rica to sell clay ceramics made in the area where they live.  All these efforts are aimed at improving her family's living conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es: Existen Mujeres con la firme decisión de emprender la lucha por la vida, involucrándose en actividades productivas para obtener otros ingresos y mejorar las condiciones  y nivel de vida, la señora Ana es una de ella que se dedica a la agricultura, pecuaria tanto ganado mayor como menor, esta señora convive con su marido en union libre no es casada, con 1 hijo a su cargo el que estudia en el colegio de la misma comarca los demás trabajan de manera independiente incluyendo a su marido los que aportan al hogar, la necesidad inmediata de la señora Ana es la compra de cerdos y semolina para  fortalecer la actividad pecuaria como es la crianza de cerdos y desarrollar el objetivo planteado, por eso se decidió visitar las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento con la finalidad antes mencionada
texts.en: There are women who are committed succeeding in life. They are involved in productive activities in order to obtain earnings and improve their life status and conditions. Ana is one of these women. She works in farming. She has large animals and small ones. She lives with her partner but they are not married.  They have one dependent child who is studying in high school. They are independent farmers. She and her partner provide for their home. Ana needs to buy pigs and semolina in order to support her cattle raising activity. Her goal is to raise pigs. This is why she visited the offices of Ceprodel. She is requesting financing in order to reach her goal.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Rafaela María

texts.es: La  señora Rafaela es originaria de un poblado del departamento, su profesión es maestra de educación Primaria, actualmente está impartiendo clases en el colegio de la zona,  con 27 años de ejercer dicha actividad, es casada con 5 hijos,  los que estudian en colegios de la localidad, actualmente solicito el crédito para mejorar su vivienda con la compra de materiales de construcción como: Cerámica, bondex, acarreo y Mano de Obra. Para mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida con ese objetivo se acerco a ceprodel para continuar solicitando financiamiento y cumplir con su sueño, ya que los créditos recibidos le han sido de gran impacto en mejoramiento mismo de ella y su hijos, ya que mejorara  el piso de su vivienda el que está en mal estado.
texts.en: Rafaela was born in a town of the department. She is a primary school teacher. She is currently teaching class in a school in the area. She's been teaching for 27 years. She is married with 5 children, who study in the local schools. She is requesting a loan to renovate her home and will invest in construction materials, such as ceramic and cement and pay for transport charges and labor. She approached Ceprodel with the objective to improve her conditions and quality of life. She will continue to request financing and fulfill her dream. Now that the floor will be repaired in her home, she knows that the loan will have a great impact on her life and her children.

loans.use: buy construction materials such as ceramic tiles and cement, and pay for manual labor.

loans.name: María Del Rosario

texts.es:
Doña María pertenece al municipio de  Niquinohomo, municipio que fue elegido para el programa de creación de alianzas para el fortalecimiento de las capacidades locales para el saneamiento de Nicaragua, es casada, con  59 años de edad,  comerciante, posee un pequeño comedor, sus clientes son trabajadores de empresitas locales y transeúntes, sus compras las realiza en el mercado municipal de Masaya. Su núcleo familiar lo conforman ella y sus tres hijos todos mayores de edad. 
Actualmente está aplicando para el proyecto de agua y saneamiento, a través de  un financiamiento para   instalar un  sistema sanitario económico que consiste en la instalación de dos inodoro convencionales con la construcción de sistema de mejoramiento, esto lo requiere   para su negocio, darle una mejor atención y presentación, por donde esta ubicado el negocio   no es posible el acceso a aguas negras, por lo que para la atencion  de sus clientes cuenta  con una  letrina, al igual que muchas familias también hay negocios que no cuentan con un   saneamiento mejorado, con este proyecto que esta beneficiando a varios municipios del país, le permitirá  contribuir con el medio ambiente. 
Sin la oportunidad de este crédito es imposible que Maria tenga acceso a un inodoro ya que es muy costoso, estos programas no solo vienen ayudar a familias, si no personas que mejoren la condiciones de su negocios,  las letrinas causan enfermedades y contaminan el medio ambiente, es por ello que nace la idea de crear estas soluciones dirigidas al sector más pobres.
texts.en:
Doña María is from the town of Niquinohom, a town that was chosen for the program creating partnerships to strengthen local capabilities in sanitation in Nicaragua. She is married, 59 years old and a business woman who has a small eatery. Her customers are workers from local companies and passersby. She makes her purchases in the city market in Masaya. Her nuclear family consists of her and her three children, who are now all adults.

Currently she is applying for funding to participate in the water and sanitation program so that she can install an economical sanitation system that consists in the installation of two conventional toilets through construction of an improved system. She needs this for her business so that she can provide her customers with an improved premises and better service. At the site where her business is located, it is not possible to have access to wastewater disposal so that she currently has a latrine to serve her customers. Like many families, there are also businesses that do not have improved sanitation. Thus this program, which is benefitting several towns in the country, will enable her to contribute to the environment. Without this loan, however, it is impossible for María to have access to a toilet because it is very costly. 

These programs not only help families but also persons who improve the premises of their businesses. Latrines cause illnesses and contaminate the environment. This led to the idea of creating solutions directed at the poorest sectors of society.

loans.use: to purchase materials to improve two bathrooms, such as adapters, sand, gravel stone , cement, blocks, iron, gravel, toilet and accessories.

loans.name: Tomas Andrés

texts.es:
Tomas, es un señor  de profesión contador, trabaja en un centro de salud de la localidad,  dedicándose a esta labor arduamente desde hace cuatro años. Es acompañado, con dos  pequeños hijos a los que tiene que proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen.
Una de las necesidades  que el  señor Tomas  atraviesa hoy en día es que debe mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda debido a que esta en malas condiciones , ha tomado la sabia decisión de iniciar  la obra. es por este motivo que acude a Ceprodel    para solicitar un crédito para Compra de materiales de construcción  tales como: cemento, arena, zinc,  perlines, hierro y pago de mano de obra.
Es importante destacar por medio de la realización de esta obra le proporcionara un techo digno donde vivir y con todas las condiciones necesaria para el desarrollo de su familia.
texts.en:
Tomas is a man working in the accounting profession. He works in a health center in the community, working hard at this job for the past four years. He lives with his two young children, for whom he has to provide everything necessary so that they can grow up.

One of these necessities that Tomas is currently attempting to meet is that he should improve the conditions of his home, because it is in bad repair. He has made the wise decision to begin this work. It is because of this that turns to Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, metal roofing, purlins (beams), and iron, and wages for the construction workers.

It is important to emphasize that the fulfillment of this project will provide him with a decent roof where they can live with everything necessary for the growth and development of their family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, metal roof sheeting, purlins (beams), and iron, and pay for workers

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora María Mercedes es comerciante  de granos básicos en unos de los Mercados más populosos de la ciudad de león, empieza sus labores a las 7:30 am preparando sus productos para ofertar a  su clientela, negocio con  el cual ha salido adelante para poder brindarle una mejor educación posible a sus dos hijos, ya que siendo madre soltera realiza el papel de padre y madre a la ves para sus pequeños.

La señora María Mercedes utilizara este crédito para comprar por mayor  grano básico tales  como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, de esa manera le permitirá   vender a precios más bajos  y así   lograr  a tener mayor clientela. 

La señora María Mercedes está solicitando crédito a Ceprodel para incrementar su inventario con productos de mejor calidad y lograr mayor venta donde obtendrá más ganancia y así tener un mejor nivel de vida de ella y su familia, ella sueña con la formación profesional de sus hijos.
texts.en:
María Mercedes is a basic grains merchant in one of the largest markets in the city of Leon.  She starts her work at 7:30am by preparing the products she will offer to her customers.  Her business has succeeded and she has been able to provide her two children with the best education possible.  Since she is a single mother, she has to be both a mother and father to her children.

María Mercedes will use this loan to purchase basic grains at wholesale such as rice, beans, sugar, and oil.  This will allow her to sell them for lower prices and gain more customers.

María Mercedes is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to increase her inventory with better quality products and have more sales.  This will help her earn more income so that she and her family can have a higher quality of life.  She dreams of her children having professional training.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, sugar, and oils.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es:
El señor Jose Alfredo es un comercinate que vive en la Ciudad de Condega a unos 35 kn al orte de la ciudad de Esteli en la parte norte del Paiz, es es soltero y se dedica a manejar un taller de mecanica en este mismo municipio siendo muy conocido por la poblacion.
Este señor atiende de lunes a sabado este taller donde ofrece el servicio de reparacion de llantas de vehiculos, soldaduras enestructuras metalicas, asi como es la mecanica automotriz, ademas tiene vehiculos de carga que el alquila para cualquien tipo de obras.
Este cliente a tenidos varios cilcos crediticios en las Oficinas de Ceprodel con los que a ido mejorando las condiciones del taller como es la cotruccion de este, mejorado el techo. ahora el se presenta nuevamente a ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un nuevo financiamiento para levantar una pared en el taller, por lo que necesita comprar cemento, arena, piedrin y el pago de mano de obra de la contruccion de dicha pared, por lo que espera positivamente que le sea aprobada la soclicitud de credito, el se muestra agradecido conde Ceprodel por los financiamiento anteriores ya que a atraves de estos el a ido mejorando su negocio ya que por cuenta propia el no podria llevar a cabo dicho mejoramiento.
texts.en:
José Alfredo lives in the city of Condega, some 35 km north of the city of Estelí, in the north of the county.  Single, José is a businessman and manages a mechanic's workshop.  José is very well-known by the city's inhabitants.

José works from Monday to Saturday.  He repairs tyres and offers soldering services for metal structures such as vehicle engines.  José also has a couple of freight vehicles that he rents out for all sorts of work.

This borrower has gone through various loan cycles with Ceprodel and these have helped him to improve his workshop, helping him to build it and to do up the roof.  José has come back to Ceprodel to apply for another loan in order to put up a wall in his workshop.  To do this work, he needs to buy cement, sand and stones, and to pay for labourers to build the wall. José is hopeful that his loan application will be accepted and he is grateful to Ceprodel for previous loans.  Through these loans he has been able to improve his business, something that he would not have been able to do alone.

loans.use: to buy cement, stone, and sand, and to pay for labourers.

loans.name: Zeneyda

texts.es:
La Joven Zeneyda posee un negocio de venta de productos lácteos en la ciudad de León, desde hace once años realiza este trabajo para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Ella sale de su casa de habitación 5:00 am ubicada en un municipio del departamento de León, abre su negocio a las 6:00 am para ofertar a toda su clientela, finalizando sus labores a las 12:00 pm de lunes a viernes en este mismo horario Por la tarde prepara su producto para el día siguiente,  inició su negocio como vendedora ambulante con un pequeño capital el cual era  producto de su ahorro y aporte de su esposo,  es  madre de tres hijos de los cuales solo dos están a cargo de su tutela.

La Joven Zeneyda solicita un crédito a Ceprodel el que  utilizara para gastos escolares (compra de uniformes para Fiestas Patrias).

La joven esta agradecida con CEPRODEL por todo el apoyo y confianza que se le ha brindado el cual le ha permitido incrementar su capital de trabajo y realizar mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Young Zeneyda has a business selling dairy products in the city of León.  She has been doing this work in order to support her household for eleven years.  Zeneyda leaves her house, in a town in the department of León, at 5am.  She then opens her business at 6am to sell to all her customers.  She finishes work at noon and works the same hours from Monday to Friday.  In the afternoon Zeneyda prepares her product for the following day. She started her business as a street vendor with a small amount of capital - a combination of her savings and some money from her husband.  Zeneyda is a mother to three children, two of whom are still under her charge.

Zeneyda is applying for a loan from Ceprodel.  She will use this to cover school costs (to buy uniforms for for independence day celebrations).

Zeneyda is very grateful to Ceprodel for all the support and trust that she has been given.  These have allowed her to increase her working capital and to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy uniforms for independence day celebrations.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Paula Aydalina

texts.es: Esta señora es originaria de un  poblado de la localidad se desempeña como maestra de primaria con 29 años de  impartir clases, su núcleo familiar se conforma por  1 hijo el cual estudia en el colegio del mismo poblado, esta señora está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de materiales de construcción, cemento, hierro, bloques, zinc y pago de mano de obra,  dicho financiamiento le ayudara a mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en: This lady is originally from a local town.  She has been working as a primary teacher for 29 years.  She has one son who is studying at the local school.  This borrower is applying for a loan in order to by construction materials, cement, iron, blocks, and zinc, and to pay for labourers.  This loan will help her to improve her living conditions and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, cement, iron, bricks, and zinc, and to pay for labourers.

loans.name: Jessel Lisbeth

texts.es:
Jessel es una joven soltera, de profesión maestra de   educación secundaria, labora en el Instituto de la localidad donde habita con  3 años de ejercer dicha actividad, Actualmente tiene una necesidad de construir un cuarto, para tener mayor comodidad en su hogar. Por tal motivo se presento a Ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como ladrillos, zinc, hierro, perlines y cemento.
Lo que vendría a darle mejores condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en: Jessel is a young, single woman.  She is a high school teacher and works in the local school.  She has been doing this work for three years. Jessel currently needs to build a new room so that her home is more comfortable.  For this work, she has come to Ceprodel to apply for a loan in order to buy building materials such as brinks, zinc, iron, purlins and cement.  This would help Jessel to improve her living conditions and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as brinks, zinc, iron, purlins and cement.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush is 54 years old, and she lives in Vanadzor city. Anush is a widow and has a son and a daughter. Her son is in the Russian Federation for work abroad, and her daughter is already married and she lives separately with her family. Anush now lives alone, and she is fully engaged in the clothes trading business. She sells a great variety of men's and women's clothes and slippers in a rented stall in a Vanadzor city wholesale market. She also rents a car once a month to bring products for sale from Yerevan wholesale clothes markets. She mentions that the income is not constant; sometimes it is so little that she really needs some support to be able to cover all her expenses. Of course, her son from time to time helps her, but he is a rented worker there and sometimes he just does not manage to find any work.
Anush asks for a loan of 800,000 Armenian drams to buy a lot of clothes for the autumn-winter collection and to renew her stall assortment.

loans.use: To buy a lot of clothes for the autumn-winter collection and to renew her stall assortment

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora lives in the village of Dalarik in Armavir region with her family--her husband and two sons (six and nine years old). Her husband is a labor migrant in Russia. To be able to cover the family’s daily costs, Nora is currently working in the private sector. The family struggles every day for a daily living and for the sake of their small children. They have livestock, consisting of cows, piglets, and hens, which is an important source of their income. In order to maintain the breeding of the livestock, the family currently needs financial resources of USD 1,200 to buy an ox and forage. The lenders' support in collecting the needed amount of the loan will greatly help the family to take care of themselves and to continue their activities in a sustainable way.

loans.use: to pay for an ox and forage

loans.name: Denys

texts.en:
Denys is 58 years old. He is a father of five children. All his children attend school. With the loan, he will buy more fertilizers for use in the rice production for a better output. The profits anticipated in the produce will be used to reinvest in the rice farming.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use in the rice production

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar lives in the Ninotsminda district with his brother, sister-in-law, niece and a mother. He is 19 years old and jobless at the moment. Edgar’s brother works as a salesperson at the grocery, and he is the only one earning money in the household. 

As that income is not enough to cover the family's every-day expenses, Edgar decided to start a new business.  He found, however, that he doesn't have enough money to do so. Therefore, he needs some credit to implement his plan. 

His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up (and restart-up) credits with soft conditions to the vulnerable poor who are regarded as “high risk borrowers.”  Because of their low income, they do not have access to credit products. 

With this credit, Edgar will purchase a second-hand car. He will serve the local people as a taxi driver and transport passengers. 

Edgar is a very enthusiastic and hard-working person with a great desire to help financially his family members. This credit will be a great support for his family. Edgar is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him the chance to generate income.

loans.use: to buy a car to use as a taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farming inputs

loans.name: Obed

texts.en:
Obed is 26 years old. He is married with one child, age one. He has been a rice farmer for the past five years. With the loan, he wants to buy more fertilizers to use in the rice production for a better output. The profits from the business will be used to build a house. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during rice production

loans.name: Garnik

texts.en: Garnik is from Shahumyan village where he lives with his big family of 8: his parents, his grandmother, wife and three children (in the photo). The whole family is involved in agriculture, which is the main source of their income. Currently, Garnik keeps livestock of cows, pigs, piglets and turkeys. The family is big so it is very difficult for Garnik to cover its daily costs. By applying for this loan, Garnik wants to purchase a cow and forage for feeding the livestock. He asks for this loan to enlarge his agricultural business and improve his family's life.  Garnik hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Nasoni

texts.en:
Nasoni is 35 years old. He is married to a farmer, and they have four children. With the loan he plans to buy fertilizer for use in the rice production. With the profits from the produce, he plans to build a house. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for use during rice production.

loans.name: Elsys Nohemy

texts.es:
Elsys tiene 32 años de edad, acompañada y con una hija de 14 años de edad. Vive junto a su hija y su compañero de vida en su humilde casa de bahareque.  Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas y su compañero de vida, trabaja como jornalero en la comunidad y por las tardes y ratos  libres  recolecta la leña que ocupara la cliente para la tortilleria; ya que elabora las tortillas en una cocina de leña (hornilla), ella no estudio en su niñez y adolescencia. Pero, actualmente se a inscrito en un curso de alfabetización en su comunidad y manifiesta que ya esta aprendiendo a leer y escribir. 

El negocio de la cliente consiste en la preparación y venta de tortillas que vende con sus vecinos y algunos empleados que trabajan en una planta de destazo de pollos,corral y granjas avicolas.

Ella compra de la ganancia de la venta del día 30 lb de maíz, para preparar la venta del próximo día. Se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. enciende la hornilla de leña y pone a cocer el maíz, mientras prepara el desayuno de su esposo para que se vaya a trabajar. Luego, saca agua de un pozo artesanal para lavar el maíz y mandar al molino de nixtamal, a las 6 de la mañana todos los días y empieza a moler. Prepara las tortillas desde muy temprano, su hija le ayuda con los oficios de la casa y se encarga de entregar las tortillas a  domicilio a algunos clientes esto lo hace hasta el medio día. Posteriormente, su hija se marcha a la  escuela por la tarde y Elsys se prepara para reunirse a las 2 p.m.  en el curso de alfabetización que imparte un vecino de ella.     

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar herbicidas, plaguicidas para curar le semilla al momento de la siembra, 3 sacos de fertilizantes y pagar algunos días de trabajo a jornales que ocupara para la limpia de terreno y  la siembra que sera en terreno de ladera bajo el sistema de labranza mínimo, y luego si  la temporada de lluvias es constante y se pueda cosechar se trasladara el grano hasta su casa donde se almacenara. 

La cantidad a cultivar son 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz en la propiedad de unos familiares.  La idea de hacer esto es para tener materia prima para la venta de tortillas y no comprar el maíz que muchas veces es escaso y caro en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Elsys is 32 years old, in a relationship, and has a 14 year old daughter. She lives together with her daughter and life partner in her humble bahareque house. She is dedicated to selling tortillas and her partner works as a laborer in the community and at night spends his free time collecting firewood for the tortilla factory. Elsys makes the tortillas on a wood stove (burner). She did not study in her childhood or adolescence, but she took a literacy course in her community and shares that she is learning to read and write.

The business consists of preparing and selling tortillas. She sells them to her neighbors and some employees that work at a poultry farm.

She buys 30 lbs of corn from the earnings of one day to prepare for the next day. She wakes up at 4:30 am lighting the stove and begins to cook the corn, all while preparing the breakfast for her partner so that he can go to work. Later, she collects water from a well to wash the corn, and at 6 am every day, she begins to grind the corn. She prepares the tortillas very early. Her daughter helps her with household chores and is responsible for delivering tortillas to the homes of some clients around noon. Then, her daughter walks to school in the afternoon, and Elsys prepares to go to her literacy class at 2 pm that is taught by a neighbor of hers.

The loan that she is seeking from Fundacion Campo is to buy herbicides, pesticides to cure the seeds at the moment they are planted, 3 sacks of fertilizer, and to pay laborers for some days of work to prepare the terrain and to plant on a hillside, which does not require much tilling.  If there is a consistent rainy season they will harvest the crop and transport the grain to their house where they store it.  

They grow 7,000 square meters of corn on the property of one of her relatives. The idea is to grow the raw materials for the tortilla business because it is very expensive to buy them in the community.

loans.use: para comprar herbicidas, plaguicidas para curar le semilla al momento de la siembra, 3 sacos de fertilizantes y pagar algunos días de trabajo a  jornales que ocupara para la limpia de terreno y  la siembra que sera en terreno de ladera bajo el sistema de labranza mínimo.

loans.name: María Santos Gloria

texts.es:
María cuenta con 38 años de edad, su grado de escolaridad llegó hasta  educación media,tiene 4 hijos de 27,20,16 y 13 años de edad; pero solo 3 viven con ella. El mayor que  tiene 27 años (está acompañado)y solo el menor está estudiando. Su compañero de vida trabaja como vigilante.


Desde hace 8 años instalo  un taller de costura, trabaja los uniformes de 3 escuelas que le ha encargado el MINED, desde joven estudio en una academia de costura y se dedicó a tiempo completo en el negocio;  es un medio de obtener ingresos ya que el compañero de vida también colabora económicamente es su hogar.

El crédito se necesita para la compra de una motocicleta que le servirá como medio de transporte a su esposo; ya que el recorrido que él tiene desde su casa hasta el trabajo es muy largo, costoso y peligroso. 
Mejorará su calidad de vida desde el punto de vista que podrá estar más tranquilo sin pensar que el transporte urbano lo deje y sin caminar demasiado.
María tiene proyectado en un futuro ser modista, hacer crecer su negocio y legalizarlo.
texts.en:
María is 38 years old, and has achieved up to a secondary school education.  She has 4 children, 27, 20, 16, and 13, and 3 of them still live with her.  The oldest, who is 27, has a partner. Among her children, only the youngest is studying. Her partner works as a guard.

She started a sewing workshop eight years ago, and works on uniforms from three schools commissioned by MINED. When she was young, she studied in a sewing school and since then has worked full-time in this business. It is a way to obtain an income since both her and her partner collaborate financially in their home.

She needs the loan for the purchase of a motorcycle that will serve as a means of transportation for her husband, since the route he follows from home to work is very long, costly and dangerous. 

It will improve their quality of life from the point of view that they will be able to be reassured without thinking that urban transportation has left him behind, or that he will have to walk too much. María plans to be a dressmaker in the future, and to make her business grow and legalize it.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Goderdzi

texts.en:
Goderdzi is 20 years old, married, and has one child.  He is from the village of Khatisopeli lives with his parents. His family runs an agricultural business and cultivates a plot of land where maize and potatoes are grown. Goderdzi breeds a dairy cow and his mother produces cheese with the milk. They also have a vineyard and sell their wine locally.

Goderdzi is a very energetic and hardworking young man and wishes to provide his family with  more income, which is why he decided to start a trading business. With this loan,  Goderdzi plans to purchase a van and use it for making fruit and vegetable deliveries. He will sell fresh produce in the neighboring villages and have a stable income, which will enable him to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a van

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en:
Avtandil is 51 years old. He lives in the small village of Lanchkhuti district with his wife and two sons. His sons go to the local secondary school. His wife is housekeeper. 

Avtandil is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has cows and a plot of agricultural land, where maize and nut trees are grown. He is very hard-working man and does his best to have a good harvest. 

In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make living. So Avtandil decided to start his own business with a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. His credit requests were rejected several times, as he was unable to satisfy their requirements. 

Avtandil received the credit he needs in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With the loan of US$ 3,000, he will buy a minibus and start trading in fruits and vegetables. He plans to purchase fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices and then resell them at higher prices. This will increase the income of his family. 

With increased income, Avtandil will be able to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus and start trading in fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is 35 years old. He is a father of five children. All his children go to school. With the loan, he would like to buy more fertilizers for use in rice production for a better output. The profits from the produce will be used to build a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during rice production.

loans.name: María Delmy

texts.es:
María de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta 3° grado. Actualmente, esta acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura pero hace meses emigro a los Estados Unidos para tener una mejor oportunidad de empleo.  Tienen 5 hijos y 3 viven en casa y de esos 2 van a la escuela a 9° y 7° grado; pero tienen que viajar hasta otra comunidad, ya que no hay un nivel de tercer ciclo en la escuela de la comunidad, y tiene a cargo a los 3 hijos y un tío vive con ella.

Ella administra el cafetín de la escuela de la comunidad y se ha dedicado al negocio por mas 6 años, en ese entonces nadie podía hacerse cargo del puesto y se decidió a ejercer el puesto, tiene que caminar un par de minutos para llegar al local y el horario es de 7 a.m. a las 12 p.m. Además, se dedica a engordar cerdos para venderlos de unos de 2 meses de edad y grandes.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar abonos y fertilizantes; pues el tío y un cuñado están sembrando 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 7,000 de pipián.

Su sueño, es que su compañero de vida regrese pronto y que sus hijos puedan seguir estudiando y que se preparen para que sean unos profesionales y puedan independizarse. 

Con las ganancias que tendría, es para invertir en la compra de alimentos para seguir engordando cerdos y generar más ingresos para ir mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
María, age 39, went to school until the third grade.  She is currently in a relationship, and her life partner works in agriculture.  However, several months ago he went to the United States in order to have a better employment opportunity.  They have five children, and three of them live at home.  Of those, two of them are in school, in the ninth and seventh grades.  However, they have to travel to another community because there is not a school in their community that teaches at the level of the third cycle.  She has three children under her care and an uncle who lives with her.

She runs the cafeteria in the school in her community.  She has worked in this business for over six years.  At that time there was no one who was able to take over the job, and she decided to do it.  She has to walk a couple of minutes in order to get to the place.  Her schedule is from 7:00 a.m. until 12:00 p.m.  She also fattens pigs in order to sell them in one to two months when they are big.

The loan she is requesting is to buy natural and chemical fertilizers.  Her uncle and a brother-in-law are planting 14,000 square meters of corn and 7,000 of pumpkins.

Her dream is that her life partner quickly returns, that her children are able to continue studying, that they prepare to become professionals, and that they can become independent.

With the earnings that she will have she will buy food in order to continue fattening pigs.  She will generate more income in order to improve her house.

loans.use: to buy natural and chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is at the age of 35. After her marriage she faced much tough time due to the occupation of her husband. At the beginning, her husband does not have permanent job to do; he has been changing his occupation in the beginning. 

Now he has a business where he provides the concrete mixer machine and labor for the construction of ceilings. Now he is constantly doing this job and earning sufficient income. 

His concrete mixer machine works through a generator. During work, the generator became out of order and in need of maintenance. Without the generator the concrete mixer machine is unable to start.

Therefore, Rehana requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner so that her husband would be able to fix the problem of the generator so that the mixer machine could work smoothly. 

Rehana always keeps in tension due to her husband’s occupation. This business is very profitable for her family and this is the only source of income for her family.
 
Rehana says thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of the generator for the concrete mixer machine.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is 53 years old. He is a father of six children. He has been in rice farming for the past 20 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more fertilizers for use in rice production. The profits from the rice farming will be used to buy a house for his residence.


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during rice production

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food products to sell.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Unidas En Acción Group

texts.es: Doña Angela 63 años de edad, vive con su esposo que también es un señor adulto mayor. Apesar de su edad a doña Angela nadie le impide continuar trabajando para generar ingresos económicos al hogar ya que actualmente dependen de una pensión que no es suficiente para cubrir sus necesidades, por lo que decidió iniciar con la crianza de pollos de engorde.  Ella con ayuda de su esposo se dedica a cuidar a los pollos desde muy temprano todos los días ya que deben alimentarlos y limpiar el gallinero donde los tienen. Este crédito le va a permitir comprar más pollos para iniciar el cuido hasta lograr un tamaño deseado y venderlo a los vecinos. Eligió Fundación Mujer por la baja tasa de interés. Doña Angela desea continuar con esta actividad y llegar a capitalizar hasta que llegue el día que no necesite más créditos y su gallinero se convierta en una granja avícola.
texts.en: Angela is 63 years old and lives with her husband who is also older. Although she is older, nobody can stop Angela from continuing to work and generate income for her house. She relies on a pension, but it is not sufficient to meet her needs, so she decided to begin raising chickens. She, with the help of her husband, are dedicated to taking care of the chickens very early every day because they have to feed the chickens and clean their coop. This credit will allow Angela to buy more chickens to raise until they are of a desired size to sell to neighbors. She chose Fundacion Mujer because of the low interest rate. Angela desires to continue with this activity and capitalize until one day she does not need more loans and she can turn the chicken coop into a poultry farm.

loans.use: to buy chicks.

loans.name: M. Zahid

texts.en:
M. Zahid is a hard working and zealous young man. He is 33 and living with his parents in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He has taken over the General Store from his father, who has grown old and mostly take bed rest due to weakness. M. Zahid is unmarried and wants to get married soon, but all his earnings are spent on household expenses and treatment of his old parents. 

Earlier, he has spent lots of income over medical treatment of his parents; this is the reason he could not buy new inventories for his general store. Now due to the lack of inventory, he is unable to offer more items to his customers and get maximum income.

M. Zahid wants to establish his general store as it was earlier but he does not have the amount to buy the missing inventories. Therefore, he requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that he would be able to buy the stocks of missing inventories such as pulses, flour, rice, etc.

His dream is to take his parents for Hajj and make some savings for this purpose. He hopes that he will make sufficient saving from the profit amount and  succeed to come true his dream.
 
M. Zahid says thanks to kiva and hopes that the lenders would support him in his noble aim.

loans.use: to restock his general store with items such as pulses, flour, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is a mother of six and lives with her husband and her extended family. She is a small-scale farmer practicing dairy farming and owns a small piece of land where she grows food crops. With three cows, Helena is able to sell at least 17 liters of milk daily and this forms her main source of income. Her husband works seasonally as a casual laborer. 

Helena uses kerosene for lighting and firewood and charcoal for cooking and heating. With the campaign against deforestation in her region, Helena decided to have a biogas plant installed for her and she approached VEP to construct it for her. Due to her many financial needs she opted for a biogas loan. With biogas, Helena will save on fuel costs for cooking, lighting, and heating. She will also promote a clean environment and afforestation. She will also benefit from the bio-slurry, which will be used as fertilizer on the farm. She also plans to sell some of the bio-slurry, which will net more income. In the end, she will save more money for her basic needs and will be in a better position to repay the loan.

loans.use: To construct a biogas plant

loans.name: Nune

texts.en:
Nune has been involved in beekeeping for many years. Currently she keeps 25 colonies of bees, gets high-quality honey, and sells it to locals. Over years of hard work, Nune has many loyal customers who prefer to purchase honey only from her. 

Now this hard-working woman-beekeeper asks a loan to increase her beehives by 14 more colonies of bees. She hopes for lenders' support as the loan is very important for Nune to increase her income from beekeeping and ensure a better life for her family. 

Nune lives with her daughter, who is 20 years old.

loans.use: to pay for 14 colonies of bees

loans.name: Rusudan

texts.en: Rusudan is 46 years old, married, and lives with her husband, three daughters, son-in-law, and infant grandchild. Rusudan works as a saleswoman in a clothing store and gets a small monthly income. Her husband and son-in-law are construction workers and work on special orders. The existing funds are very small and hardly enough for covering expenses, so Rusudan decided to start a grocery store to increase the family income, but she needs financial support to implement her plan. Unfortunately, Rusudan lacks access to financial institutions to obtain credit to start a business, as they require a stable income and business experience. She received the credit in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo--the start-up program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With the loan of USD 1,900, Rusudan will purchase basic groceries to set up a grocery store. She will take care of her clients and treat them in a kind and friendly way. Her daughters will assist her running the business. With this credit, she expects to improve her income and increase the turnover gradually. Rusudan will work hard to tackle her financial difficulties and make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to start a grocery store

loans.name: Victor  Hugo

texts.es: Hugo vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus 3 hijos, él se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz, pipianes y plátanos, tiene  ya varios años de dedicarse a esa  actividad, comercializa sus productos en los mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, Hugo está solicitando un crédito para la compra de herbicidas, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, etc. para seguir con sus cosechas y así obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Hugo lives in his own house with his wife and three kids. He is dedicated to agriculture, especially the sowing of corn, *pipianes*, and plantains. He has been doing this for many years and sells his products in markets that are close to his home. Huge is seeking credit to buy herbicides, fertilizer, seeds, etc. to continue with his harvests and obtain a larger income to give his family a better quality of life.
.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, fertilizers, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Edith Ruth

texts.es: Doña Edith vive en casa propia, junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de variedad de productos como golosinas, ollas, carteras, cremas, perfumes, juegos de cucharas, etc.  desde hace 3 años su negocio esta ubicado en una zona  muy transitada, es una persona honesta, responsable, un con muy buen carácter, además posee  capacidad de pago, gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos, doña Edith solicita un crédito para invertir en su negocio y poder comprar más productos como:  cepillos, pastas, jabones, etc.  para poder obtener  mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Doña Edith lives in her own house, along with her life companion and their son. She sells a variety of products such as candies, pots, purses, creams, perfumes, spoon sets, etc. For three years her business has been located in a zone with a lot of traffic. She is an honest and responsible person, of very good character. In addition, she has the ability to pay. Thanks to her effort, she has managed to pay many of her expenses. Doña Edith is applying for a loan to invest in her business and be able to buy more products such as brushes, pasta, soaps, etc., to be able to obtain greater income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy candies, pots, purses, creams, perfumes, spoon sets, brushes, pasta, soaps, etc., for her store

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es: Doña Ernestina de 50 años vive en casa propia con sus hijos y un nieto, ninguno depende de ella, hace 16 años se dedica a su propio negocio que es una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de su negocio  logra solventar algunos gastos de su familia, Doña ernestina solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos para su tienda como: golosinas, huevos, sopas, jabón, sopas, etc. y así satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ernestina, 50, lives in her own house with her children and grandson.  None are dependent on her.  She’s owned her own business, a home-based store, for 16 years that she earns income with to cover some of her family’s expenses.

Ernestina’s asking for a loan to buy stock merchandise for her store like snacks, eggs, soups, soap, soups, etc.  to meet her customers’ needs.  She expects to provide better quality of life for her family this way.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Silvia Beatriz

texts.es: Silvia Beatriz de veinte años de edad vive junto a su madre y un hermano de 16 años, ella es empleada, cuida dos niños pequeños y además para complementar los gastos de su hogar lava y plancha en diferentes lugares donde solicitan su servicio. Silvia es una mujer trabajadora, humilde, y muy responsable, su propósito diario es dar su mejor esfuerzo para darle a su familia una mejor vida, su pequeña vivienda aun no ha terminado de construirse faltan algunas paredes, y quiere acabar el trabajo lo más pronto posible pues la época de lluvia le genera inseguridad a los miembros del hogar; desea empezar lo más pronto posible pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar cemento, ladrillo, arena y piso. Silvia Beatriz espera cumplir con los pagos, y agradece ayuda brindada.
texts.en: Silvia Beatriz is 20 and lives with her mother and 16-year-old brother. She has a job looking after two small children, and she also provides a washing and ironing service to provide additional income to cover household expenses. Silvia is hardworking, humble and very responsible. Her aim every day is to work as hard as she can to give her family a better life. Her small home is still unfinished and is missing some walls, and she would like to finish the work as quickly as possible so the house is secure for the rainy season. She needs money to do this, so she is asking FUSAI for a loan which will enable her to buy cement, bricks, sand and flooring. Silvia Beatriz is hoping to be able to meet her repayments, and is grateful for any help received.

loans.use: to build walls by buying cement, bricks, sand and flooring.

loans.name: Elmer Arnoldo

texts.es: Elmer  Arnoldo de treinta años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hija en casa propia desde hace dos años. Él es agente de seguridad y su compañera trabaja de secretaria, los dos trabajan duro para salir adelante; él es un hombre responsable y de familia, siempre está luchando por darles una vida mejor,  su vivienda necesita algunas reparaciones dos de las habitaciones desea repellarlas con cemento y además quiere cambiar las laminas del techo pues están muy viejas y se filtra el agua, espera realizar los arreglos lo más rápido posible pues eso les dará mas comodidad. Esta decidido en solicitarle a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar los materiales cemento, lamina galvanizada, arena, etc. Pues no posee de solvencia económica para costear los gastos. Elmer Arnoldo agradece la ayuda y se compromete junto con su esposa a pagar la deuda.
texts.en:
Elmer Arnoldo, 30, has been living together with his life partner and daughter in a house of their own for two years. He is a security guard and his partner works as a secretary; both work hard to get ahead. Elmer Arnoldo is a responsible family man and is always fighting to give his family a better life.

Their house needs some repairs. He wants to plaster two rooms and change the roof's metal sheets, since they are old and leak. He hopes to fix this as soon as possible so that they can live more comfortably.

He decided to request a loan at FUSAI to buy materials such as cement, galvanized metal sheets and sand, since he does not have the money to buy them on his own. Elmer Arnoldo appreciates the help he is receiving. He and his wife promise to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy cement, metal sheets and sand to plaster the walls and repair the roof.

loans.name: Eberto Antonio

texts.es: Don Eberto de 41 años de edad es una persona muy emprendedora y responsable, vive en casa de unos familiares con su esposa y su hijo, hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don Eberto solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas, controles de plagas, etc. con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Eberto is 41 years old and is a very entrepreneurial and responsible person. He lives in his relatives' home with his wife and child. For several years he has made a living growing corn and beans. He sells his produce in the different markets that are close to his place of residence. He is able to cover some of his living expenses with the money that he makes in his business. 

Eberto is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies like fertilizers, manure, seeds, herbicides, pest control products, etc. With this he hopes to be able to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies like fertilizers, manure, seeds, herbicides, pest control products, etc.

loans.name: Lotus Group

texts.en:
Yohana, who is in his mid 30s, is married with three children: two daughters and one boy. Yohana’s children are in school.  For two years now he has had a carpentry business, making different kinds of furniture such as sofa sets, cupboards, chairs, tables, and beds. He does these activities in the same place, and in the front he has opened a showroom where customers can come to select and buy the furniture. He starts working at 6 a.m. and ends at 6 p.m. Sometimes he stays to 10 p.m. if he has a client’s orders. Yohana is able to earn a very good profit per month. 

This is his first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he will use for buying more wood for the furniture business. He dreams that one day he will be able to own an industry. He is doing very well. 

Yohana will share this loan with his loan group “Lotus” which totals 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more wood for his furniture business

loans.name: G.s. El Paraiso Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario EL Paraíso está conformado por tres integrantes ellos residen en el departamento de Chinandega en el occidente del país lo cual es una zona comercial y existe gran demanda, 

Rosalina es propietaria de una pulpería en la que vende productos de consumo como:  granos básicos, arroz, azúcar, maíz, frijoles, aceite, productos perecederos como: tomates, cebollas, chiltomas, maduros entre otros, al igual que golosinas, productos refrigerados, cosméticos, ropa, entre otros ella inicio su negocio primeramente con la venta de mercadería en general luego obtuvo mejores ingresos y fue así que pudo poner su pulpería, desde hace 11 años tiene el cual con muchos sacrificios y esfuerzos ha logrado sacar adelante, 

Dina se dedica a la venta de ropa en general como: pantalones, blusas de vestir, chores, camisetas al igual que cosméticos entre ellos pinturas de uñas, maquillajes, perfumes cremas y otros.

Evert se dedica a la venta de granos como maní, semilla de jícaro, cacao, y otros también brinda el servicio de soldadura, instalación de techos, y otros. 

El objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en los diferentes negocios que ellos poseen,  ellos están muy agradecidos por la ayuda y el apoyo que los Inversionistas Kivas brindan a personas con escasos recursos y a países pobres como Nicaragua para tener un medio digno de trabajo.
texts.en:
The El Paraíso solidarity group is made up of three members.  They live in the department of Chinandega in the western part of the country, a very commercial area with a lot of demand.

Rosalina owns a grocery store where she sells products such as basic grains, rice, sugar, corn, beans, oil, and perishables like tomatoes, onions, chiltoma peppers, and bananas.  She also sells sweets, refrigerated products, cosmetics, clothing and other things.  Rosalina first started her business selling general merchandise.  Then she earned more income and was able to start her grocery store.  She has had it for 11 years, and with a lot of sacrifice and effort she has managed to get ahead.

Dina makes a living selling general clothing such as pants, blouses, shorts, and t-shirts.  She also sells nail polish, make-up, perfume, creams, and other cosmetics.  

Evert makes a living selling peanuts, calabash seeds, cacao, and other grains.  He also offers soldering services, roof installation and other things.  

The goal of this loan is to invest in their various businesses.  They're very grateful for the help and support that Kiva investors give to low-income people and poor countries like Nicaragua so they can earn a decent living.

loans.use: to invest in each one's business

loans.name: M. Asad

texts.en:
The person who is shown in the picture is named M. Asad. He is 28 years old and living in the populated area of Lahore, Pakistan. He has been running a small general store for three years and its working very well. His shop is situated under populated area and lots of customers are available there to offer miscellaneous general store items to. 

He does not want to refuse and disappoint any respected customer for any product or item. He wants to offer all those products which are necessary and consumable in daily routine for household. In this way he would succeed in winning the trust of his customers and increase his income as well. 

He wants to offer additional items such as bread, jam, little bit of stationery items, soft drinks, and ice creams, but he does not have a refrigerator to keep the ice cream and jam fresh.

Therefore, M. Asad requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that he would be able to buy a refrigerator and additional item such as bread, jam, stationery items, soft drinks, ice creams, etc.

M. Asad is very glad after taking this loan and hopeful that he will succeed in fulfilling each request for any item and abstain from disappointing his customers.  

M. Asad is very thankful to kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan, and assures us to pay all his due installments on time and with regularities.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and additional items such as bread, jam, stationery items, soft drinks, and ice creams for his general store.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is 43 years old and has seven children aged 30, 28, 26, 24, 22, 20, and 18. He is into farming, which is his major source of income. In addition to farming, he also trades in firewood to boost his income. He started farming in the year 1993 in Ruharo central ward-Ishaka Division. His major purpose for starting the business was to have a source of income. Francis’s clients are the local people in the same area, and the main purpose of the loan he applied for (1,500,000 UGX) is to buy seedlings from a nursery bed for planting to conserve the environment. He strongly believes that with his hard work, if given the money he will buy many seedlings which he will plant to make his area a better place.

loans.use: To buy seedlings

loans.name: Ivania Del Rosario

texts.es: Ivania del Rosario reside en el departamento de Chinandega mayor de edad casada con dos hijos menores de edad es propietaria de un negocio de nintendos y videos juegos que tiene en su casa de habitación ella con es una mujer trabajadora, responsable, y con ganas de superación  ha podido administrar su negocio, ella solicita crédito para la compra de activo fijo que consiste en play station y xbox3co el cual le servirá para incrementar la demanda y de esa manera poder tener mejores ingresos para su familia, y poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella agradece la oportunidad y la ayuda que los Inversionistas kivas le brinda para tener un medio digno de trabajo.
texts.en:
Ivania del Rosario resides in the Department of Chinandega.  She is older in age, married, and has two young children.  Ivania is the owner of a Nintendo and video game business in her home.  She is a hardworking and responsible woman who desires to excel in managing her business.  

Ivania is requesting a loan to purchase fixed assets, such as PlayStation and Xbox consoles, so that she can respond to the increased demand and generate more income for her family.  As a result, she will be able to help her children move forward.  She is grateful for this opportunity and the assistance from Kiva lenders who have given her the chance to work in a decent manner.

loans.use: to buy PlayStation and Xbox consoles.

loans.name: Moises Francisco

texts.es:
Moisés de cuarenta y cuatro anos de edad,  originario de Nagarote, el se caracteriza por ser una persona trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación. Nagarote está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfruta con sus familia. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligado a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Por lo cual trabaja día a día para que sus hijos tengan un futuro mejor.
Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de madera, actividad que la desempeña en su casa de habitación, y dedica unas 10 horas diaria ofreciendo sus productos. en la foto   esta con equipo de trabajo para cortar madera, y esta con su hijo que le ayuda en el negocio.  El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de madera para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Moisés agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Moisés is forty-four years old, and is a native of Nagarote.  He is characterized as a very hardworking and responsible person, and as someone who has the drive to be better.  Nagarote is located in the western part of the country.  In his free moments, he likes to enjoy time with his family.  Unfortunately, he could not study for a career, since he was obligated to work from a very young age in order to help with home expenses.  He therefore works day to day so that his children can have a better future.  

Thanks to his efforts and desire to get ahead, he now works selling firewood.  He does this work in his home, and dedicates about ten hours every day to this activity.  His son is also in the photo as he works with his team to cut wood.  

He will invest in working capital and in supplying his business so that in the not-too-distant future, he can make a better income.  Moisés is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors have offered to people who come from scarce resources and poor countries, like Nicaragua, in order to have a means of dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to supply his business with different types of wood, like pine, laurel, pochote, guanacaste, oak, and cedar.

loans.name: Banco Comunal Cristo Rey Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Cristo Rey está conformado por 8 integrantes madres y padres con 15 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ellos son originarios del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Son personas trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal, en sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos. Y prepárales comida típica de la región como es  “EL buñuelo” lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudieron cursar una carrera y se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora del banco es Aracelis y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es su casa de habitación, una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, pan, leche, huevos, detergentes, jugos, frutas, caramelos, tiste, cebada. Ella invierte unas 12 horas diarias en su negocio. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal  Cristo Rey  agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The "Cristo Rey" communal bank is comprised of 8 members, mothers and fathers with 15 children in their responsibility. They are from the community of Sauce which is located in the northern area of the country. They are hard-working, responsible people with a desire of self improvement. In their spare moments they like to enjoy the company of their children and prepare typical food from the region which is "el buñuelo" (cream puff). Unfortunately, due to the lack of economic resources they were not able to study for a degree and they were obligated to work since an early age to help with the home expenses. 

Thanks to her efforts and desire to move forward the coordinator of the bank is Aracelis. Her business is a grocery store located in her house. The store is small and she sells edible products like rice, sugar, beans, bread, milk, eggs, detergents, juice, fruits, caramels, hot chocolate, and barley. 

She invests 12 hours daily in her business. The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her grocery store so that in the not-so-far future she may obtain more income. The communal bank "Cristo Rey" is thankful for the help that the Kiva investors provide to people of limited resources and poor countries like Nicaragua in order to have a dignified type of work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her grocery store with rice, sugar, beans, bread, milk, eggs, detergents, juice, fruit, caramels, hot chocolate, and barley.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
La Señora Elvira una persona emprendedora honesta y seria, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos  en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la  compra y venta  de  ganado o reses. 
Doña Elvira el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de ganado.  Con el préstamo ella espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más  reses  que ofrecer a los clientes y cubrir las necesidades de los mismos y con esto generarse ingresos que le permitan mejorar su situación  económica y la  de su  familia.  
Doña Elvira  espera que  en unos 2 años  su negocio siga  creciendo y  consolidándose  para que se convierta en la más grande y  reconocido de la zona y seguir  apoyando a su familia,  para que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y se conviertan en personas honestas con principios y valores para la  sociedad.



Choluteca, Honduras –  Agosto   del   2013
texts.en:
Elvira's an enterprising, honest, and serious person.  She lives with her husband and four children in the south of Honduras.  Her business is buying and selling livestock, or cows.

Elvira needs the loan to buy livestock.  She hopes her business sales will increase when she has more cows to sell to her customers.  She also hopes to cover the needs of the livestock so she can generate more income for herself to improve her family's economic situation.

Elvira hopes that in two years her business will continue to grow and get stronger so it becomes the biggest and best known in the area.  She also hopes to continue supporting her family, so her children finish school and become honest people with social principles and values.

Choluteca, Honduras, August 2013

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Marlen

texts.es:
La señora Marlen una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad en la zona  sur de Honduras junto a  sus  hijo y esposo.Su negocio es la venta de comidas desde hace varios años, vende en su casa de habitación y lugares cercanos a su residencia. 
Doña Marlen necesita el préstamo para la compra de plátanos, repollo, tomate, carne de pollo, de res, manteca, salsas, etc. materia prima para seguir realizando su actividad la cual forma la mayor parte de sus ingresos y así mismo desea bríndales más  producto a sus clientes ya  que son bastantes y en este momento no cuenta con los recursos necesarios.
Doña Marlen con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho para mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia 
Doña Marlen su sueño es que en un corto plazo su negocio crezca y con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y seguir apoyando a sus hijos en los estudios.



Choluteca, Honduras – Agosto del  2013
texts.en:
Marlen, a very hard-working and responsible person, lives with her son and husband in a community in southern Honduras. For several years her business has been selling food. She does this from her house and in areas nearby her home.

Marlen needs the loan to buy plantains, cabbage, tomatoes, chicken, beef, lard, sauces, etc., the ingredients to continue carrying on her business, which forms the greater part of her income. As well, she wishes to offer more product to her customers, as she has quite a few of them and does not have the necessary resources at this time. 

With the loan, Marlen expects her sales to increase and that this will be a great help to her in improving quality of life for her and her family.

Marlen's dream is that in a short time her business will grow, and that this will enable her to continue supporting her family and helping her children with their education. 

Choluteca, Honduras – August, 2013

loans.use: To buy plantains, cabbage, tomatoes, chicken, beef, lard, sauces, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Nedita

texts.en:
Nedita is 57 years old and lives in Catagan, Tangub City. She is married with one child.  

Nedita has a service business and earns approximately PHP 1500 each day doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan to repair her house. 

Nedita has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to improved her family's living condition.

loans.use: repair her house

loans.name: Berta Faride

texts.es:
Berta es una señora soltera de 28 años de edad, vive junto a sus 2 hijos, 1 hombre y 1 mujer en el Molino Belén zona 2 Barrio San Bartolo Sololá, Sololá. 
Ella se dedica a la profesión de maestra en la Escuela y también tiene a su cargo el puesto de Directora que se encuentra en Sololá. Eligio esta actividad porque le gusta trabajar con los jovenes ya que la educación es la base fundamental para la formación del ser humano. 
Ella ahora cuenta con 10 años de experiencia, en este campo que le ha ayuda al sostenimiento de su familia a través de su ingreso económico. 
Ella esta solicita un préstamo de Q 3,000.00 para la compra de una computadora, ya que de esta manera podrá trabajar mejor. 
Su sueño es construir su vivienda y darle una educación de calidad a sus hijos para que en un futuro tengan mejores oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Berta, 28, lives with her two children, a male and a female, in Zone 2 of Molino Belén in the San Bartolo Sololá neighborhood of Sololá.

Berta's a teacher at a school in Sololá, where she's also the principal.  She chose this job because she likes to work with young people and because education is the foundation for the formation of human beings.  She has 10 years of experience in this field, which has helped her support her family with her income.

She's requesting a loan for 3,000 quetzales [GTQ] to buy a computer so she can work better.

Berta's dream is to build her house and give her children a quality education so they can have better life opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es:
Gabriel es un hombre casado de 52 años de edad, vive junto a sus 3 hijos 1 hombre y 2 mujeres Panajachel, Sololá.

El es un hombre que lucha por sacar adelante a su familia. El ha elegido este trabajo de albañilería porque gracias a los consejos de sus amigos él decidió trabajar en ello. A través de lo que realiza a podido obtener ingresos aceptables para contribuir al sustento familiar.
