This past year, he successfully graduated from high school and was accepted to the Tajik State National University where he is majoring in economics.  He enjoys reading books and playing sports.  He is hoping to do well at the university.  He needs to pay his tuition, but doesn't have enough money to do so.  He is taking a loan to pay for his tuition.  He is awaiting your kindness and relying on your compassion.

loans.use: to pay for his education.

loans.name: Seanghay

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house with her family members in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district, Seanghay is aged 48 years and married with three children; one of whom is still in school. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice. To add more income, she also works as a paid worker. Having been in this business for twenty-six years, she manages to earn about 46,000 KHR per day and can save about 22,000 KHR each day for future needs.

Seanghay is just with VisionFund this cycle. Now, she is applying for a loan of 2,500,000 KHR to buy a proper motorbike for commuting to work. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a decent motorbike for using in her family.

loans.use: To buy a proper motorbike for commuting to work.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Fedaa

texts.en: Fedaa was born in 1983. She is married and has two sons. Her husband and brother are in the military. Fedaa started making baskets using straw for the past one year. She started her project at home. Then, she started receiving requests from her neighbors. Fedaa is planning to expand her project in the future by opening her own workshop to sell her products. Now, she needs to buy raw materials such as more straw to increase her productivity and income in order to cover her children's needs. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more straw and other raw materials for her basket-weaving business.

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en:
Ibtisam was born in 1976. She is married and has three children. Her husband works in car rental. Ibtisam has been selling foodstuffs since two years ago. She started her project with a few products, and it expanded over time to be a supermarket. 

Ibtisam is planning to add variety to her products such as housewares and cleaners in order to raise her income to be able to support her husband in covering their children's needs. Now, she is asking for a loan to be able to buy those items.

loans.use: To buy housewares and cleaners.

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.ru: Мавзуна родилась в 1994 года. Она не замужем. Мавзуна умная и современная девушка. Она студентка 2 курса Таджикского Государственного Университета Таджикистана. Мавзуна учится по специальности бухгалтера. Она учит хорошо все предметы, которые она изучает в университете. Она мечтает в будущем стать высококвалифицированным специалистом. Она живет с родителями. Ее мать работает учительницей в средней школе. Ее родители не в состоянии оплатить за ее учебный договор в университете. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mavzuna, born in 1994, is a smart and modern girl.  She is not married.  She is a second-year-student at the Tajik State National University, majoring in accounting and doing well in all subjects.  She is dreaming of becoming a highly skilled specialist one day.  She lives with her parents.  Although her mother works as a high school teacher, Mavzuna's parents are not in a position to pay for her education.  For that reason, she is taking a loan to pay her university tuition.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her education.

loans.name: Men's Group

texts.en:
Men is a 63-year-old married woman residing in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Tbung Khmum district. She has six children and earns a living through farming rice. Having been in this business for almost 40 years, she can earn about KHR 30,000 per day to make a living and can save about KHR 10,000 each day for the future needs.

Men has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She successfully used the past loan to better her living condition. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Men, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more rice so as to increase her family’s income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman with six children, who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mary Ann is 54 years old.

Mary Ann has a food vending business in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional foods like tempura, squid rolls, fish balls, etc. to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional foods like tempura, squid rolls, fish balls, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Om-Munir Group

texts.en: This group is called Om-Munir and consists of four members. They live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They are working hard so that they can achieve their goals. Zakia is 40-years-old and is the leader of the group. She sells sweets. She has been doing this for four years. She says that she began this business when she felt her husband isn't able to cover all the expenses of his family. She is hardworking and through effort and dedication has managed to overcome adversity and get ahead. She is asking for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB to buy sweets in order to be able to continue her business. She is working towards increasing her income.

loans.use: to buy sweets in order to be able to continue her business.

loans.name: Savann's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village located in the Kandal province’s Sa Ang district, Savann is aged 27 years and married with three children, all of whom are still small. For the last four years, she and her husband have been selling fish, and sometimes her husband also works as a paid construction worker in the local area. The current business earns her family about 14,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per business.
 
Savann has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles, and she completely paid back the loans, which have enabled her to afford to better support the family. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to buy a motorbike for her her family's commuting. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her family's commuting.

loans.name: Sroem's Group

texts.en:
A 35-year-old mother of two children, Sroem resides in a rural village of the Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district, Cambodia. To support her living, she has been growing cabbage, while her husband is a paid construction worker. Together, they can earn about 23,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day from the current business and can save about 15,000 KHR each day for their future needs.

Sroem has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles, and completely paid back the past loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan of 170,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy materials for construction of a proper latrine. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a decent latrine for using in her family.

loans.use: To buy materials for construction of a proper latrine.

loans.name: Gladys Ernestina

texts.es:
La señora Gladys Ernestina  posee un negocio de venta de productos alimenticios en  unos de los mercados de la ciudad de león, se dedica a este negocio desde hace quince  años para  el sustento de su familia. 

La señora Gladys Ernestina se traslada a su puesto de trabajo a las 6:00 am y abre su negocio a la 7 am para preparar los mas riquísimos platillos que sus clientela le solicita,  finalizando a las 5:30 pm de lunes a sábado y el domingo hasta el mediodía.
  
El  crédito que  solicito a Ceprodel será utilizado para comprar al por mayor de mercadería tales como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceites, carnes de res y de pollo, especies, el cual le permitirá aumentar sus ganancias y obtener mayor clientela.
texts.en:
Gladys Ernestina has a business where she sells food in one of the Leon city markets.  She has been doing this for 15 years in order to support her family.

Gladys Ernestina travels to her work place at 6:00 am and opens at 7:00 am to prepare the delicious dishes that her customers want.  She finishes at 5:30 pm Monday through Saturday, and at noon on Sundays.

She will use the money from this CEPRODEL loan to buy ingredients such as rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, beef and chicken, and spices, which will allow her to increase her earnings and in more customers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 28-years-old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Michelle works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requests a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell such as noodles, cooking oil, candies, biscuits, soft-drinks, etc. in her general store. Michelle has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, cooking oil, candies, biscuits, soft-drinks, etc. In the future, Michelle would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell such as noodles, cooking oil, candies, biscuits, soft-drinks, etc. in her general store.

loans.name: Zaid

texts.en: Zaid was born in 1970. He is married and has four children. Zaid has been working as a blacksmith for the past five years. He started his project as a hobby. He also works at a private company. He is trying to earn better income to be able to cover all his children's needs. So, he is planning to expand his project; the first step to do that is to buy more iron in order to respond to his customers’ requests and raise his sales. But, he currently doesn’t have enough money for that. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more iron for his blacksmith workshop business.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en: Sabah was born in 1959. She is married and lives in a rented house in an area in Jordan called Wihdat. Because Sabah is a conservative woman, she asked her son to appear in the picture instead of her. Sabah has been working in making furniture with her son for the past 11 years. To increase her profit, she needs to buy different types of wood. This will help her to add variety to her products and to raise her productivity and income as she currently doesn't have enough money for it. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy different types of wood for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Doña Marta es una señora de 57 años que habita en la comarca Las Pilas ubicada a 10 km del municipio de El Sauce. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado al comercio y hoy en la actualidad tiene una pequeña pulpería ubicada en su vivienda donde ofrece abarrotería en general, también elabora lo que es cuajada la cual es a base de leche de vaca.
Doña Marta inició este negocio con un pequeño capital que le regalaron sus hijos los cuales trabajan en Costa Rica con el objetivo de que su madre no caminara de manera ambulante en las comarcas vendiendo y pusiera su negocio en la casa.
Doña Marta tiene un día apretado se levanta a las cinco de la mañana a elaborar la cuajada para luego abrir la pulpería.
En este momento tiene la necesidad de un crédito para surtir el negocio con el cual pretende comprar leche, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, frutas, gaseosas, aceite y ropa con el fin de satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
Espera y confía en Dios que los inversionistas de Kiva a través de Ceprodel apoyen su solicitud para seguir adelante luchando por la vida.
texts.en:
Marta is 57 years old and lives in the Las Pilas settlement, located 10km from El Sauce.  She has been a businesswoman since she was very young and currently has a store in her home where she sells general grocery items.  She also makes milk curds from cow’s milk.

Marta started this business with a small amount of capital that her children gave her; they work in Costa Rica and didn’t want their mother to have to walk around the town to make her sales. 

Marta has a busy day.  She gets up at 5:00 am to make the curd and then opens the store.

She needs a loan for her business and will use the money to buy milk, rice, beans, sugar, fruit, soft drinks, cooking oil, and clothing so she can satisfy her customer demand.

She hopes and trusts in God, that the Kiva lenders, through CEPRODEL, will support her request so she can continue ahead with her life.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima was born in 1980. She is married and lives in a rented house in an area in Jordan called Irbid. Fatima has been selling blankets and accessories for the past one year. She started her project selling accessories only. Then she added other products. Fatima is planning to open her own store in the future. Now she is requesting a loan to be able to buy more blankets and accessories in order to raise her sales and profit. Because Fatima is a conservative woman, she asked her husband's cousin to appear in the picture instead of her.

loans.use: To buy blankets and accessories to sell for her retail business.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela is 52 years old and widowed with three children. Miguela works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional inventory to sell in her general store.

Miguela has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, biscuits, noodles, bread, etc. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory to sell in her general store

loans.name: Laura Lila Clariza

texts.es: En el municipio de Quezalguaque departamento de León, La señora Laura, se dedica a impartir clases como maestro de primaria, en un pequeño colegio del municipio, dedicándose a esa labor desde hace 29 años, es Soltera con 1 hija a los que tiene que proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo, ya que está estudiando, Una de las necesidades que la  señora  Laura atraviesa, es de realizar el pago de un lote de terreno, por lo que se decidió  de acudir a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para realizar dicho pago.
texts.en: Laura lives in the city of Quezalguaque, within the Leon department, and works as a teacher in a small town elementary school.  She’s been doing this for 29 years.  She is single and has a daughter whom she wants to provide for, since she is attending school now.  One of the things Laura needs to do is pay for a piece of land, so she is asking for a loan through CEPRODEL.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Maysoon

texts.en: Maysoon was born in 1979. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a retired man. So he doesn't have a strong source of income. Maysoon has been running her own beauty salon at home for the past four years. She started her project with few customers that consisted of her family and neighbors. Then they increased by time. Now Maysoon is planning to raise her productivity by buying cosmetic products and other tools for the salon. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products and other tools for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 49 years old and has four children. Dolores is married and has two children who are still in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Dolores requests a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Dolores has been raising pigs for 6 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina is 50 years old and married with two children.

Agustina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requests a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional inventory to sell like canned goods, biscuits, noodles, bath soap, etc. in her general store.

Agustina has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns additional income from electronic mobile load retailing.

Agustina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory to sell like canned goods, biscuits, noodles, bath soap, etc. in her general store

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 46 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requests a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, milk, cream, soy sauce and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Francisca has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns additional income from fruit and vegetable vending.

Francisca aspires to build and expand her business to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, milk, cream, soy sauce and other groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda works hard to support her family. Rosenda has a live-in partner and has a general store business in the Philippines. She requests a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, toothpaste, shampoo, coffee and other groceries to sell.

Rosenda has been in this business for 7 years now. In the future, Rosenda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, toothpaste, shampoo, coffee and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Chicualense Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria de estado civil unida de hecho, cuenta con 26 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 1 hijo que aun no estudiando, se dedica a tejer cortes y guipiles tipicos, unició este negocio con la ayuda de su madre y hasta la fecha lleva 6 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de hilos y telas para tejer variedades de estilos, desea en el futuro tener un local propio en el mercado del municipio. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a tejeduría y actividades pecuarias. En la fotografía faltan dos integrantes puesto que no pudieron asistir al momento de tomar la foto.
texts.en:
Maria is in a de facto union and is 26 years old. She did not have the opportunity to study. She has one child, who is not at school yet, and she makes a living by weaving traditional skirts and blouses. She began this business with the help of her mother and she now has six years of experience.
She organises a group and she is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase threads and fabrics to weave a variety of styles. In the future she wants to have her own shop in the market of her municipality. The other members of the group make a living from weaving and farming. Two members are missing from the photograph since they could not be present at the time the photo was taken.

loans.use: to purchase thread and fabric for weaving

loans.name: Pio Agustín

texts.es: El señor Pio , es casdo ,se dedica arduamente  a laborar como Coordinador técnico en el ministerio de educación, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace 8 años y 23 año de haber ejercido la labor de maestro de primaria, es Casado con 2 hijas a su cargo, Una de las necesidades que el señor  Pio  atraviesa hoy en día es de Mejorar su vivienda, como es la construcción de un cuarto  y asi darle mejores condiciones a su familia, ya que debido a esta necesidad, le `permitió tomar la decisión de visitar a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de Materiales de construcción como: Cemento, Arena, Bloques,  Piedrín, Hierro, perlin  y Mano de Obra.
texts.en: Pio is married. He makes a living by working hard as a Technical Coordinator for the Ministry of Education. He has been doing this job for eight years, after having worked as a primary teacher for 23 years. He is married with two daughters in his care. One of the needs Pio has is to improve his home by building a room to give his family better living conditions. Since he has this need, he allowed himself to make the decision to visit CEPRODEL to request a loan for paying labourers and purchasing building materials, such as cement, sand, bricks, gravel, iron, and purlins.

loans.use: to pay labourers and purchase building materials, such as cement, sand, bricks, gravel, iron, and purlins

loans.name: Juana Lisbet

texts.es: La señora Juana se dedica arduamente a laborar como maestra de educación primaria en un pequeño colegio del municipio dedicándose a esta labor desde hace 14 años. Es acompañada,y tiene  un pequeño un hijo al que le tiene que proporcionarle las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrolle. Una de las necesidades que presenta esta señora es de mejorar su vivienda ya que se encuentra  en mal estado, por este motivo es que acude a ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como: cemento, perlines, arena, piedrín y el pago de la mano de obra, y de esta manera darle mejores condiciones a su familia
texts.en: Juana works hard as a primary teacher in a small school in her municipality. She has had this job for fourteen years. She has a partner and a young son, for whom she has to provide conditions conducive to his development. One of the needs this woman has is to improve her home, as it is in a bad state. It is for this reason that she approached CEPRODEL to request a loan so she can pay labourers and purchase construction materials, such as cement, purlins, sand, and gravel. In this way she will be able to give her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay labourers and purchase building materials, such as cement, purlins, sand, and gravel

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is a married woman with five children, one of whom is in school. She is 56 years old and is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rufina has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Rufina has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Rufina has been in this business for 23 years. Rufina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Santas

texts.en:
Santas is 59 years old and married with four children. Santas works very hard to provide for her family.

Santas runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell such as canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, bread, milk, etc. in her general store.

Santas has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, bread, milk, etc. 

Santas would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell such as canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, bread, milk, etc. in her general store.

loans.name: Al-Matry Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Matry and comprises five ladies. They have applied for a loan of 150,000 YER. Abeer lives in Hodeida, Yemen. She is 31 years old and has nine children. She has been selling clothes for ladies. She is a professional in this field and her goods are sought-after in the market. She started her business with a small amount of capital to assist her husband in providing for their children's expenses. She is applying for a loan of 30,000 YER to buy clothes. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand her business and improve the living standards of the family. Her dream is to expand her business in order to sell different products.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Asmahou

texts.fr:
Madame Asmahou  est née en 1985 à Sikasso, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est vit avec son époux dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Bougoula-Ville, le centre ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Asmahou est tailleur de formation, à défaut de pratiquer cette profession elle s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et de vente des  fruits (mangues, oranges,  bananes, papayes, avocat, ananas, etc.) depuis quelques années. Elle mène son activité au grand marché de  Sikasso et de façon ambulante. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ plus de deux année. Après trois prêts individuels bien remboursés, elle sollicite ce quatrième prêt individuel afin d’acheter  des chargements de charrettes en différents fruits pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante., 
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Asmahou was born in 1985 in Sikasso. She's married and the mother of two children. She lives with her husband in a large traditional extended family in Bougoula-Ville, the city center of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

She's a trained tailor, but instead of practicing this profession, she became familiar with the buying and selling of fruits (mangoes, oranges, bananas, papayas, avocados, pineapples, etc) a few years ago.

She runs her business at the Grand Market in Sikasso, and as a traveling saleswoman. About two years ago, eager to better satisfy her ever-increasing clientele, she decided to join Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso.

After three personal loans that were repaid without problems, she's seeking her fourth loan in order to buy cartloads of various kinds of fruits and better meet an ever-increasing customer demand.

Thanks to this loan, she foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 100'000 (ca US$ 200) to be used to help cover the expenses of her family, and repay the loan. She will reinvest the remainder in her business.

loans.use: to buy cartloads of various kinds of fruits

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 44 years old and single. She works very hard to provide for her children.

Alma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional goods to sell in her general store.

Alma has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, candies, biscuits, etc. 

In the future, Alma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: María Dioselina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Chimborazo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 3 hijos de 21, 17 y 9 años, solo la menor estudia en la escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Doña María es una muy buena esposa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) y  ropa por catalogo. Trabaja cuatro días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra todos los días domingo. Lo que más vende son los perfumes. Lleva más de 8 años que se dedica a las ventas con la cual ayuda a su marido a salir adelante en el hogar.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de todo tipo. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos.

Su sueño es terminar su casa.
texts.en: Communal bank Chimborazo meets every other week at Picoaza church, in the town of Portoviejo, known as a market town and boasting traditional celebrations such as the San Pedro and San Pablo festivities. The people there are very cheerful. María lives in this town. She is forty years old, married, and has three children, aged 21, 17, and 9. Only the benjamin, a girl, goes to school. María's husband owns a shop. María is a very dutiful wife who, in order to have her own income, sells products of the brand Avon (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies' accessories) and clothes from a catalog. She works four days a week and sells on credit: her customers pay her every Sunday. Perfumes are what she sells the most. She has been in this business for eight years, and her income helps her husband pay for household expenses. She asks for this loan to buy perfumes, moisturisers, cosmetics, and clothes of all kinds. She is one of the founding members of the communal bank she belongs to. She enjoys being a part of it because it helps her with her loans. Her dream is to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, moisturisers, cosmetics, and clothes.

loans.name: Twubakiranire Group

texts.fr:
Gloriose  fait partie du groupe  Twubakiranire  et  habite à Bujumbura. C’est une veuve de 42 ans et a 3 enfants âgés de 16 à 20 ans, tous étudient. 

Elle  fait le commerce de restaurant  depuis  20 ans. 

Elle est à son neuvième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter  son capitale et acheter  une grande quantité d’articles (haricot, riz, régime  de bananes, …) à revendre dans sa boutique, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années à venir, elle  voudrait  faire le commerce d’importation et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Gloriose is a member of Twubakiranire Group. She's a 42-year-old widow who lives in Bujumbura. She has three children, aged 16 to 20, who all go to school.

For twenty years, she's been selling food products. She's seeking her ninth loan from Kiva's partner, Turame. She will use it to bolster her working capital and buy a large quantity of products (beans, rice, banana bunches, etc) to resell in her store, in order to increase her income.

In the forthcoming years, she would like to get into the import business and see her children study.

loans.use: buy a large quantity of products (beans, rice, banana bunches, etc)

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is married, and works hard to support her family. Corazon has a buy and sell recyclable materials business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 8 years now.

Corazon requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy more recyclable materials to sell.

In the future, Corazon would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more recyclable materials to sell

loans.name: Erwina

texts.en:
Erwina is 41 years old and single. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Erwina has a Fuller Life direct selling business in the Philippines. Erwina requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more Fuller Life products to sell.

Erwina has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Erwina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more Fuller Life products to sell

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 53 years old and married with three children. With one child currently in school, Flora works very hard to provide for them.

Flora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of laundry soap, shampoo, coffee, candies, etc. to sell in her general store.

Flora has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Flora would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of laundry soap, shampoo, coffee, candies, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Delfina Mariana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Chimborazo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora Delfina, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 4 hijos de 16, 14, 12  y 7 años, los tres mayores  estudian en el colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Doña Delfina se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y  su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, su esposo también es comerciante de ropa y zapatillas, mientras ella vende por la localidad él se desplaza a otras ciudades o en el centro de la ciudad a vender sus productos, ella  deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada domingo. Lleva más de 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad y es así como ellos luchan para que sus hijos tengan una buena educación y un mejor porvenir.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el banco comunal desde sus inicios y le gusta porque gracias a los  créditos salen adelante. 

Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Chimborazo" meets every 15 days in the Picoaza Parish in the city of Portoviejo.  It is a place known for being very commercial, for its traditional St. Peter and St. Paul festivities and for the cheerfulness of its people.

This is where Delfina, 38, lives.  She is married and has four children, ages 16, 14, 12 and 7.  The three eldest are in middle school and the youngest in grade school.  Her husband is a merchant.

Delfina sells all kinds of clothing on a door-to-door basis.  Her husband also sells clothing and shoes.  While she sells in the town he goes to other cities or to the city center to sell his products.  She sells her products on a credit basis and collects payment every Sunday.  She has been in this business for over four years.  This is how they struggle to give their children a good education and better future.

She will use the loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing.  She has been a member of the communal bank since its beginnings; and she likes it because thanks to the loans she is able to get ahead.

Her dream is to continue prospering with her business.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria, de 36 años de edad, está casada con Andrés quien es comerciante  y padre de sus hijos. Vive en su casa propia en compañía de su familia. Maria tiene un salon de juegos de billar, además de la  venta de golosinas y bebidas gasificadas. Se inició hace más de 02 años en está actividad, pues ya tenía mesas de billar que fueron traídos de otra localidad y el cual lo instalaron en su domicilio actual, logrando hacerlo crecer. También vende golosinas y bebidas a las personas que van a jugar y los que pasan por el lugar, a quienes atiende de manera amable. Por otro lado tiene planes de ampliar su negocio e instalar un local más para venta de comida. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y está muy contenta de  saber que cuenta con un apoyo financiero que le permite seguir adelante con su negocio. Por tanto se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas de manera puntual. El monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en el arreglo del local como pintado de paredes, además de  la compra de bebidas gasificadas y golosinas al por mayor y así tener mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en: Maria is 36 years old. She is married to Andrés, who is a merchant and the father of her children. She lives in her own home with her family. Maria has a billiard hall and also sells snacks and sodas. She started more than 2 years ago with this activity. She already had the billiards tables that were brought from another place and installed in her present home, making it grow. She also sells snacks and drinks to the people who go to play or who pass by, and she serves them in a friendly manner. On the other hand, she has plans to expand the business and set up a locale to sell food. This is her second Kiva loan and she is very happy to know she has financial support that will allow her to continue forward with her business. That is why she is committed to making the payments on time. The amount of 1000 nuevos soles she has asked for will be invested in fixing up the locale, such as by painting the walls. She is also going to buy sodas and snacks wholesale to sell and thus have more income.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her locale and buy soda.

loans.name: Johana Paola

texts.es: Johana  de 24 años de edad habita al sur de la ciudad y genera ingresos propios, desde hace 5 años, con su actividad de vender productos cárnicos y mercancía variada como perfume, calzado, ropa y accesorios femeninos. Su espíritu negociante lo heredó de su madre quien con su actividad comerciante la impulsó para que la ayudara con sus gastos. Así fue como se incorporó  en la venta de productos mediante guías especializadas o catálogos y poco a poco su negocio ha ido creciendo y así mismo sus expectativas de crecimiento y desarrollo. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito y de contado diariamente durante las horas de la mañana mientras sus compras las hace a los proveedores de sus catálogos y en almacenes del centro de la ciudad donde hay ofertas especiales., para tener mayor efectividad en su oferta mediante precios ajustados a la población objeto en la que incursiona. Su meta mas adelante es tener un almacén y terminar su carrera universitaria, pero su mayor desafío es la falta de recursos para cumplir rápidamente sus sueños. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará perfumería, accesorios femeninos, colonias, pantalones, suéteres, calzado etc. Con ello espera incrementar sus ventas y aumentar sus ganancias, para poco a poco cumplir su meta de prosperidad.
texts.en: Johana is 24 years old. She lives in the southern part of town and has earned her own income for 5 years, selling meat products and various merchandise such as perfume, shoes, clothes and women's accessories. She inherited her business sense from hr mother, who as a merchant drove her to help with the expenses. That was how she started in sales with products from specialized guides or catalogues and little by little she has grown and so have her expectations for growth and development. She sells on credit and up front every day during the morning hours and does her buying from suppliers of the catalogues and in stores in the center of town where there are special deals in order to be more effective offering adjusted prices to the community where she goes to sell. Her goal in the future is to have a store and finish college, but her biggest challenge is the lack of resources to achieve her dreams quickly. At this time, she is applying for a Kiva loan. With it, she will buy perfumes, women's accessories, colognes, pants, sweaters, shoes, etc. With this, she hopes to increase her sales and her earnings in order to little by little achieve her goal of prosperity.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, women's accessories, colognes, pants, sweaters, and shoes.

loans.name: Al-Ward Group

texts.en:
The Al-Ward group consists of three women who are friends living in Hodeida, Yemen. This group is requesting a loan of 130,000 YER from AMB in order to increase the member's activity level. 

Othmana is the leader of the group. She is 37 years old. She has been selling clothes in her own region for three years. She started her business to assist her with her children's expenses. She has requested a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy a supply of fabrics in order to meet her customers' needs, and to increase her turnover and income. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a supply of fabrics in order to meet her customers' needs.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta 4° grado, no pudo seguir con sus estudios por el estado económico que tenían sus padres. ella esta acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tienen cuatro hijos que viven con ella, y dos de ellos están estudiando 1° y 2° grado en la Escuela de la comunidad.

Ella se dedica a los oficios domésticos, en su tiempo libre se dedica a palmear tortillas para el gasto familiar y un poco para la venta, ya que se esta al pendiente de sus hijos, mientras su pareja esta trabajando en el campo.


Solicita el crédito especialmente para comprar insumos agrícolas, como abonos y fertilizantes; ya que su pareja siembra maíz y necesita mejorar su calidad de vida, ya que obtendrán ingresos para comprar lo necesario para ir sobreviviendo.

Su sueño, es poseer una casa propia, y que sus hijos sigan estudiando para que puedan ser profesionales en un futuro, las ganancias serán invertidas en la educación de los hijos y para la alimentación, esperan sacar buena producción para obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
María is 32 years old and has a fourth grade education.  She was unable to continue her studies because of her parents' economic situation.  She and her partner are farmers and they have four children who live with them.  Two are in first and second grades at the local school.

She is a homemaker and in her free time makes tortillas to sell to help out with household expenses.  She cares for the children while her partner works in the fields.

She is requesting a loan to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers.  Her partner grows corn and wants to improve the family's quality of life by earning more income to buy the things they need to get by.

Her dream is to have her own home and for her children to get professional training for the future.  She will spend her income on education and food.  Hopefully they will have a good harvest to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies such as fertilizers.

loans.name: As'ad

texts.en:
As'ad is a 46 years old married man from Rafah city. He is a father of five children; three sons and two daughters. All of them are attending school. 

As'ad is an employee in the public sector and he gets a low income which is not enough to cover all the family needs. For the past three years, As'ad has opened a small store in the city where he sells women's clothes to help him to increase the family income. It is a good business and he earns a good income, but the store needs more money to be improved. 

As'ad took out a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products for his clothes store for a very good price, which will improve his store and also his income. 

As'ad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more products for his clothes store.

loans.name: Yaqwt Group

texts.en:
This group is called Yaqwt. It is made up of four women, who are neighbors from Hodeida, Yemen. They are hard-working and enterprising women. They took a loan of 120,000 YER. 

Wafa is the group's leader. She is a 29-year-old married woman. She completed her secondary school only. She sells fabric and various other items, and has over two years of experience. She stocks fabric, robes and dresses to sell to her clients. Since she has professional experience in this field, she attracts more clients, which helps her business to continue to run successfully and makes the business more profitable. 

Recently, she took out a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to invest in her business by buying more fabrics, skirts and dresses and reselling them to her customers. This loan will allow her to strengthen her business so that she can increase her revenue. She hopes to earn large profits so that she can improve her savings in order to obtain a big loan to further expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics, skirts and dresses to sell

loans.name: María Margarita

texts.es:
María cuenta con 53 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, su compañero de vida se dedica a la agricultura, tiene dos hijos uno de ellos estudia, el otro trabaja.

Ella posee una tienda desde hace 20 años, el negocio lo aprendió sola; más que todo por la necesidad que existía en la zona de tener un lugar en donde ir a comprar productos de la canasta básica. Entonces, ella la instalo cerca de una escuela, el hijo que está estudiando le ayuda atender los clientas cuando sale de la escuela.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar pollo, chorizo también golosinas ya que en la zona se venden mucho con los estudiantes, arroz y frijoles productos que los cliente les busca.

Uno de sus sueños es ampliar  la tienda y tenerla bien surtida y satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes que le visitan y así se vayan complacidos con los productos que vende. Manifiesta que con las ganancias obtenidas podrá sacar adelante a su hijo que se prepare en una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
María, 53, has a ninth grade education.  Her common-law husband is a farmer and they have two children who attend school.  Their third child works.

She has been running a store for 20 years and learned the trade all by herself.  The main reason for opening the store was the need for a place to buy basic goods.  So, she opened one near the school.  One of her sons helps her attend to customers after school.

The loan she is requesting through Fundación Campo is to buy chicken, sausage, sweets (which are popular among the students), rice, and beans, which are in demand.

One of her dreams is to expand her store and keep it well stocked to meet all of her customers' needs.  That way she can keep them happy.  She will use the profits to help prepare her son for a university education.

loans.use: To buy chicken, sausage, sweets, rice and beans.

loans.name: Fedra

texts.es:
Fedra vive en la zona de Villa el Carmen de la ciudad de La Paz, se dedica a la venta de comidas. Fedra necesita el crédito para poder refaccionar el ambiente o local  donde realiza este servicio para así atraer a mas clientela obteniendo mayor utilidad y poder cubrir con los gastos que tiene en su hogar.

El sueño de Fedra es poder reunir el suficiente dinero para abrir más de un restaurante, incrementando sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Fedra lives in the Villa el Carmen area of the city of La Paz. She sells food. Fedra  needs the loan to be able to do some repairs in the locale where she provides her service in order to attract more clientele, obtaining more profits to be able to cover the household expenses. 

Fedra's dream is to be able to get enough money together to open more than a restaurant, increasing her income to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to some repairs on the locale where the client sells food.

loans.name: Haitham

texts.en:
Haitham is a 26-year-old single man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. 

He has a taxi which used to provide for his living expenses. He collected money from his previous career in a company to buy a taxi. Recently, his taxi is not working well due to lack of money to repair it. So, he applied for a loan of 100,000 YER to buy spare parts to repair his taxi. 

In the future, he would like to buy another taxi to increase his profit.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Jaime Otoniel

texts.es:
Jaime hombre de 49 años de edad, no fue afortunado y no tubo la oportunidad de asistir a la escuela, ya que sus padres eran de escasos recursos y la pobreza les impidió ofrecerle el estudio a sus hijos. Su esposa, se dedica a elaborar tamales de gallina y tamales pisques, sus 3 hijas han terminado el bachillerato, aparte de su esposa e hijas tiene a cargo a su mamá. 


Él es panificador en pequeño, oficio que aprendió de 17 años, gracias a que su hermano le consiguió trabajo donde él laboraba. Actualmente Don Jaime, se encarga de distribuir los tamales en su bicicleta, ya que su esposa, esta operada y le imposibilita salir a distribuir los tamales. Ellos elaboran los tamales en su casa, con ayuda de su hija y su cuñada. Él sale a las 5:00 a.m. en su bicicleta a vender los tamales de gallina, por todo el pueblo, y a las 3 de la tarde empieza de nuevo a comercializarlos, pero entonces son tamales pisques (Un producto de mucha tradición nacional).

El préstamo sera utilizado para trabajar en el negocio de la panadería, y comprar la materia prima: harina, azúcar, manteca, bandejas etc y comprar una mesa donde pueda tener el producto. Con el préstamo, se le podrá ayudar en gran medida, ya que posee un horno, para trabajar en la panadería, y lo mas importante que ya tiene experiencia en el negocio.

El sueño de Don Jaime, es ser un panificador en grande, poder comprar un horno con mucha mas capacidad. También desea tener una motocicleta, para salir a vender el pan, de esa manera se le hará mas fácil el recorrido para la venta.

 Tiene la necesidad de remodelar su casa y ampliarla, para tener mas comodidad. Todos esto, dice que lo lograra con su esfuerzo y con la ayuda de los créditos, y por eso se siente muy agradecido.
texts.en:
Jaime, 49, was unable to go to school, unfortunately, because his parents were poor and could not afford to give him an education.  His wife makes chicken tamales.  His three daughters have finished high school and his mother lives with the family.  Jaime is a baker, a trade he learned when he was 17 years old thanks to his brother who got a job for him where he was working.

Now Jaime distributes tamales using his bicycle, because his wife recently had an operation and cannot go out to sell.  His daughters and sister-in-law help make the tamales and he goes out at 5:00 a.m. to sell them throughout the village.  At 3:00 p.m. he starts selling tamales again but these are the traditional tamales "Pisques".

The loan will be used to buy raw materials for the bakery such as flour, sugar, shortening, trays, etc.  He will also buy a table to display the products.  The loan will be of great help to him.  He has an oven and, most importantly, the experience to run the business.

Jaime's dream is to have a larger bakery and buy a bigger oven.  He also wants a motorcycle to go out and sell bread which will make work easier.  He also wants to renovate and expand his home to make it more comfortable.  He says he will accomplish everything with hard work and the help of the loans for which he is very grateful.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for his bakery such as flour, sugar, shortening, trays and a table.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is from the Arab village of Gush Halav in the upper Galilee. She is in her early 20s and gained her BA in Business Management while completing a Cosmetic and Treatment training. 

Rania strives for success and after working for others knew she could make her own business succeed. She opened a salon on the first floor of her home, with living quarters above. The salon has a separate entrance and is accessible to customers from Gush Halav and the surrounding towns. Rania keeps up to date and trained in latest treatments and has an excellent base of steady and walk in customers. She is known for the quality of her treatments and personal care to each of her customers.

Rania needed this loan to assist in purchasing a facial ultrasound device, facial massage machine, humidifier, paraffin bath, hair removal device, creams, materials and cosmetics.

Rania not only provides treatment, she also sells cosmetic creams and supplies. She wants to one day have a full service salon serving the region.

loans.use: To purchase a facial ultrasound device, to buy a facial massage machine, humidifier, paraffin bath, hair removal device, creams, materials and cosmetics for her salon

loans.name: José Mario

texts.es:
José de 27 años de edad, asistió hasta 4º grado de educación básica, debido a que sus padres no disponían del tiempo suficiente, para trasladarlo todos los días hasta la escuela, la cual estaba a 3 kilómetros de su casa, y por el trabajo, se les hacia difícil llevarlo para que estudiara. 

Su compañera de vida, se dedica a cuidar a sus 4 hijos (11, 9, 4 años de edad y uno de 4 meses) y a realizar los quehaceres del hogar; sus hijos asisten a la escuela, que se encuentra ubicada a 800 metros de su casa. 

Por su parte, José se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura, siembra 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, oficio que aprendió a los 12 años, cuando su padre lo llevaba a los sembradíos, para que fuera conociendo y aprendido el manejo que se le da al cultivo de maíz. El terreno el cual cosecha esta ubicado a 6km de su casa, para trasladarse tiene que viajar en un carro que pasa por su comunidad, de ahí, se baja y camina 1 hora, para terminar así su recorrido. Su horario empieza desde las 5:00 a.m. cuando aborda el carro y termina hasta las 2 de la tarde. Cuando tiene que regresar a su casa.

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar los fertilizantes, para darle la suficiente nutrición al cultivo, también comprara los herbicidas e insecticidas, y pagara la mano de obra de 3 ayudantes.

El sueño de José, es sembrar mas cerca de su casa, y no tener que viajar tanto. También, esta dispuesto a ayudarles a sus hijos para que estudien y tengas mas oportunidades en la vida y que no sufran las dificultades que él ha  tenido que atravesar. Ademas, desea mejorar su vivienda, la cual esta muy deteriorada, a causa de los terremotos que hubieron en el país.
texts.en:
José, 27, has a fourth grade education.  He could not continue his education because his parents did not have the time to take off work to take him to school, which was about three kilometers from home.

His common-law wife cares for their four children (ages 11, 9, 4 and 4 months) and is a homemaker.  Their children attend school which is about 800 meters from home.

José is a farmer, a trade he learned when he was 12 years old.  His father used to take him out during planting season so he could learn all about growing corn.  His land, which is 7,000 square meters, is six kilometers from home and he takes transportation that travels through the community.  When he gets off, he still has an hour to walk to get to the land.  He starts work at 5:00 a.m. when he boards the vehicle and works until about 2:00 p.m. when he returns home.

The loan will be used to buy fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides, and to hire three workers.

José's goal is to be able to grow crops closer to home so he does not have to travel so much.  He also wants to help his children get an education so they will have more opportunities in life and not have to face as many difficulties as he did.  He also wants to renovate the home, which is very run down because of the earthquakes suffered in the country.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides for his crops and to hire three workers.

loans.name: Hanin

texts.en:
Hanin is a 28-year-old business owner from northern Israel. She opened a nail salon in her home. After her business grew, customer demand could not be met and she decided to renovate the area under her home for a larger treatment area. Hanin’s sister, who owns a successful hair salon in another village, has helped Hanin learn and advertise her business. Hanin has been quite successful and her business shows her good potential.

Hanin needed his loan to assist with renovation costs and materials. She used it to assist in renovating which included redoing the electricity, as well as purchasing light fixtures, a work table and chairs, paint, flooring, an air conditioner, the door, signage, fixtures and manicure materials.

Hanin wants to continue and see her nail salon grow, develop and expand. Hanin has support from her family, who believe in her and want to see her succeed. She wants to see her family grow as well and step, by step, create a successful business.

loans.use: To assist with renovation costs and materials.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 35 years old and lives in Silanga, Tangub City. Angelita is married with 3 children.

Angelita has a Sari-Sari Store and earns approximately PHP 2,000.00 each month doing this type of work. She has applied for a loan to buy additional basic commodities for her store.

Angelita has been a member of PMPC for 1year and 6 months. In the future, Angelita hopes that her Sari-Sari Store will be a grocery store.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is 38 years of age and a resident of Motibot, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. She is married with 3 kids. They have a little fishing business from which to earn a living. With their business they meet many challenges, but they realized that it is good to face the challenges rather than get discouraged. 

Rosalyn and her husband work hard in selling their catch to the market. Sometimes there are wholesale buyers from other towns and cities who come to buy their fish. With their savings, they welcome the idea of expanding their business. They have requested from Paglaum MPC a Php 5,000 loan. They feel assured of Paglaum’s help, should there be a need for working capital in the future. Rosalyn smiles at the thought of seeing their children get their own diplomas one day.

loans.use: to buy fishing supplies to expand their business.

location.town: Sindangan -  Motibot, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva is 48 years old and lives in Migcanaway, Tangub City. She is married with 4 children. 

Primitiva has a piggery and earns approximately PHP 5,000.00 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan to add to her working capital. 

Primitiva has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Primitiva hopes to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: to have additional working capital for her piggery.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en: Ofelia is 50 years old and lives in Sta. Maria, Tangub City. She is married with 4 children. She has a motorcycle rental business and earns approximately PHP 6,000.00 each month doing this type of work.  Ofelia has been a member of PMPC for 4 1/2 years. In the future, she hopes to purchase another new motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia, 45, is a married resident of Pangalalan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. Her husband is a tricycle driver. They have 1 child who is studying in primary school. Starting with capitalization of 3,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Because of this financial assistance, she has been able to generate savings and enjoys the benefits given by the co-op. She became a member last April 2008 and has taken out five loans. 

Now she is applying for 14,900 PHP to buy additional items for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart, and will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy products to sell.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 48 years old and lives in Silanga, Tangub City. She is married with 3 children.

Fe has a piggery and earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. 

Fe has been a member of PMPC for 1 year and 6 months. In the future, she hopes to have more pigs.

loans.use: to buy sacks of feed for her piggery.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is married with 3 children. He is 47 years old and lives in Upper Centro, Tudela, Philippines.

Jose sells gasoline to earn a living ,and he has had this business for 10 years. Each month, he earns 3000 PHP doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of 10000 PHP to purchase additional gasoline and other products such as gas sampling bottles, gas cylinder manifolds, and gas sampling bags.

Jose has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Jose hope to provide for his family's basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional gasoline and other products such as gas sampling bottles, gas cylinder manifolds, and gas sampling bags.

loans.name: San José  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo San José está formado por 10 mujeres quienes viven por un hermoso sector de Santa Ana en Cuenca, desde el centro de esta parroquia se puede observar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, gracias a su geografía accidentada tiene hermosos paisajes para  disfrutar de la naturaleza. Su gente son personas muy amables y gentiles que siempre están en busca de un mejor porvenir para sus familias, eso lo logran con el trabajo y sacrificio a diario.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Rosa Elena, se encuentra desde hace 3 años en el grupo de crédito San José, en todo este tiempo ha ido mejorando sus lasos de amistad con todas las compañeras del grupo, al mismo tiempo que los créditos le han beneficiado para sacar adelante a su familia.

La Señora Rosa Elena tiene 39 años de edad, es una mujer casada que en u su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos, dos de ellos ya son mayores de edad, están casados y viven independientes, sus tres hijos menores están estudiando dos en el colegio y uno en la escuela.  Su esposo labora en la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que viven es propia.

Doña Rosa Elena pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo en su casa al cuidado de su hogar, pero para aportar a la economía de su hogar trabaja como empleada domestica y también en su casa cría cuyes, cerdos y gallinas.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes, gallinas y materiales de construcción para el arreglo de su casa. 

Su meta es tener más cuyes y mejorar la raza..
texts.en:
The San José group is made up of ten women, who live in a beautiful sector of Santa Ana in Cuenca.  From the centre of the parish you can see a large part of the city of Cuenca and, because of its rough landscape, there is plenty of scenery to enjoy nature.  The people here are very friendly and gentle.  They are always looking for a better future, something they achieve through daily sacrifice.

One member of this group is Rosa Elena. She has been with this group for three years, during which time she has developed friendships with all members of the group.  At the same time, loans have helped her to move ahead with her family.

Rosa is 39 years old.  She is married and, from this relationship, has five children.  Two of the children are now married and independent adults, while the other three are still in school - two in high school, one in primary.  Rosa's husband is a builder.  The family lives in their own house.

Rosa spends most of her time looking after the home but, to support the family economy, she works as a maid and also raises guinea pigs, pigs and hens at home.  

Rosa will invest this loan in buying guinea pigs, hens, and building materials to do some repairs at home.

Rosa's goal is to have more guinea pigs and to improve breeding.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, hens, and building materials.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Née en 1976 à Sikasso, Madame Fatoumata est une veuve et mère de deux enfants  elle vit chez son oncle avec un de ses enfants à Bougoula-Ville, le centre ville de Sikasso.
Madame Fatoumata mène des activités d’achat et de vente des condiments alimentaires il y a environ cinq années au grand marché de Sikasso dont elle dispose d’une place. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’accroitre, elle décida d’intégrer le programme  crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ deux ans et avec qui elle est à son quatrième prêt individuel, les 3 prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce quatrième prêt lui permettra d’augmenter son stock de condiments en achetant 15 cartons maggi, 10 cartons de concentrée de tomate, 15 sacs d’oignons, 20 cartons de moutarde. 
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 95.000 FCFA qui sera utiliser pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born in 1976 in Sikasso, Fatoumata is a widow and mother of two children. She lives with her uncle and one of his children in Bougoula-Ville, the downtown area of Sikasso.

Fatoumata has been in the business of purchasing and reselling spices for around 5 years in the big market of Sikasso where she has a stall. As a result of needing to better meet the needs of her customers, whose demands never cease to grow, she decided to partner with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso about two years ago as part of their loan program. She is now on her fourth individual loan, with the 3 previous loans having been fully repaid.

This fourth loan will allow Fatoumata to increase her stock of spices by purchasing 15 boxes of maggi, 10 cartons of tomato concentrate, 15 bags of onions, and 20 containers of mustard. With this loan, she hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 95,000 francs CFA which she will use to support her family, pay the interest back on the loan, and invest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase spices

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Âgée de 33 ans, Madame Mariam est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle vit avec son époux au quartier Médine de la ville de Sikasso.
Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, elle s’est initiée depuis plus de deux ans à cette activité de vente d’oignons au nouveau  marché de Médine où  elle dispose d’une  table et où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son septième crédit qui lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’acheter, 45 sacs d’oignons de graines différentes (25 sacs de petites graines et 20 sacs de grosses graines).
Ses marchandises sont vendues au comptant à une clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes de ménage.
Avec ce nouveau crédit elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 105 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce,  contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
33 years old, Mariam is married and the mother of three children. She lives with her husband in the Médine neighborhood of the city of Sikasso. After having tried several businesses without success, two years ago Mariam began her current business of selling onions in the new market in Médine where she has a table and where she is much sought after by customers for the quality of her products.

In order to meet the growing needs of her customers, she decided to partner with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, with whom she is now on her seventh loan. This will allow her to increase her business funds and purchase 45 bags of various kinds of onions (25 bags of small seeds and 20 bags of larger seeds.) 

Mariam sells her merchandise for cash to a customer base made up mostly of housekeepers. With this new loan she hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 105,000 francs CFA which she will use to grow her business, provide for her family, and pay back the interest on her loan.

loans.use: to purchase spices

loans.name: Rosa Angelina

texts.es: Rosa Angelina mayor de edad casada con tres hijos menores de edad aun bajo su responsabilidad, originaria del municipio de Chinandega zona ubicada en el occidente del país donde predomina el comercio y el turismo, Rosa posee un tramo de calzado ubicado en uno de los mercados de este municipio, donde ofrece variedades de estilo de zapatos como: sandalias, deportivos para niños, adultos, almohadas, floreros, entre otros ella realiza sus compras en otro municipio del país al por mayor , tiene clientes fijos y eventuales los cuales les ofrece productos al contado y al crédito recuperando semanal y quincenalmente, Rosa desde muy temprano comienza su jornada de trabajo hasta algo tarde, no es primer crédito que ha trabajado con león 2000 siendo cumplidora en sus pagos, responsable, ahora Rosa esta solicitando nuevamente financiamiento para invertir mas en su negocio debido a que se aproximan las fiestas patrias y su demanda ha incrementado tiene varios encargos por lo que ella necesita para capital de trabajo y pode cumplir con sus clientes, Rosa esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en: Rosa Angelina is married and has three children, all aged under 18 years old, under her responsibility.  Originally from the rural Chinandega area in the west of the country - an area dominated by business and tourism -, Rosa has a shoe shop in one of the town's markets.  There she offers a variety of shoes, such as sandals, sports' shoes for children and adults, and more.  Rosa buys her merchandise in bulk in another of the country's cities.  She has regular customers and also passers-by who come in to buy products.  Rosa sells in cash and on credit, collecting payments monthly and fortnightly.  Rosa's day begins very early and ends very late.  This is not her first loan with León 2000 but she has been reliable with her payments, and responsible.  Rosa is now applying for a new loan in order to invest more in her business - independence day holidays are approaching and demand has increased.  She has various orders to fulfill and so needs working capital in order to keep her customers satisfied.  Rosa is very grateful for the support that Kiva investors are providing to people with little money.

loans.use: to buy working capital, such as a variety of shoes and other accessories, to increase her stock.

loans.name: Las Del Polígono  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Las del Polígono está conformada por 8 socias y 1 socio, quienes viven por la parroquia de Paccha en Cuenca, lugar que goza de mucha vegetación, de verdes campos y por su geografía accidentada tiene varios paisajes para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo colonial y lo moderno. Su gente al igual que las socias son personas amables y gentiles que guardan la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, se dedican a la crianza de animales, a la agricultura, al comercio y algunos salen diariamente a laborar en la ciudad en diferentes actividades económicas.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Transito de Jesús, está realizando su primer crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito Las del Polígono, todas las integrantes de este grupo tienen una muy buena amistad y su propósito en común es el de superarse día a día.

La Señora. Transito de Jesús tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 5 y 3 años, su primer hijo está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, la casa en la que viven es arrendada.

Ella trabaja como empleada en un restaurante de lunes a sábados y le va muy bien en su trabajo.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ollas y vajillas para tener utensilios de cocina ya que está en proyecto de ponerse su propio restaurante. 

Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The "Las de Polígono" group has eight women members and one male member.  They all live in the Paccha parish of Cuenca, an area lush with vegetation and green fields.  And because of its rough landscape, there is plenty of scenery to enjoy nature.  The architecture here is a mixture of colonialism and modernism.  The locals, like the "Las del Polígono" group members, are friendly and good people who are preserving the culture and traditions of their towns.  The people here make a living form raising animals, in farming, and in business.  Some travel daily to work in other jobs in the city.

One member of this group is Transito de Jesús.  This is her first loan, which she is taking out alongside her friends and colleagues in the "Las del Polígono" group.  All the groups members are very good friends and their common goal is overcome problems.

Transito de Jesús is 26 years old, married and has two children - aged five and three years old respectively - with her husband.  Her oldest is attending one of the city's schools.  Transito de Jesús's works for a private company.  The family lives in rented accommodation.

Transito de Jesús works in a restaurant from Monday to Saturday and the work is going well.

Transito de Jesús will use this loan to invest in pans and crockery so that she has cooking utensils - she is currently in the process of setting up her own restaurant.

Her goal is to own her own house.

loans.use: to buy pans and crockery.

loans.name: Salom Group

texts.en:
To a child’s ear “mother” is magic in any language, says young and hard-working Agui. She lives with her father and sister only. She also shares how much she misses her mother, who left them for her heavenly abode when they were young. 

She runs a pan-dukan on the village roadside. She is pictured with her hand raised and she is the featured borrower member for Salom Group. The group comprises 14 members and they are cooperative and supportive of each member with respect to financial stability and moral ground. They live in a village that is about 35 kms away from the capital town of Manipur.

Agui runs the shop on the main road lane of the village. The shop was built by her father and his friend three years back. She sells pan, tobacco nuts, tobacco leaves, cigarettes, local cigarettes, sachet shampoo, sweets, candies, detergent soap, detergent powder, etc. She says, village farmers usually stop at her shop to buy pan and cigarettes to take them to their field, and  while returning from the fields they stop again for pan and cigarettes. Agui shares that villagers love chewing pan and smoking cigarettes as it is affordable for all. 

She wants a loan from Kiva to get more stock for her shop. The present income is insufficient to get abundant supplies as she also shares family financial problems. Therefore she is planning to get more supplies like bathing soap and more pan items like tobacco nuts and leaves. She has plans to expand her pan shop into a grocery shop in the future. The lack of a big grocery shop in the village creates lots of hassles for the villagers as they had to travel to the main town market for grocery items. She is happy that her plans will be fulfilled and thanks Kiva and WSDS for the support.

The rest of the group members are engaged in running tea-stalls, selling chives, weaving and farming.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her shop and expand the shop.

loans.name: Rengsai Shg Group

texts.en:
In autumn, these ten hard working tribal women formed a group called Rengsai. They live in a small village that is 30 kms away from the city Imphal in the state of Manipur, which is in the northeastern part of India. 

Thangakim is the member pictured with her hand raised and she is the featured borrower member for the group. She is 30 years old and a mother to a beautiful daughter. Her husband is a laborer who cuts wood and bamboo from the jungle and supplies it in the market. 

Since her husband’s income could not sustain the family, in order to reduce financial worries, she opened a grocery shop in the village. She keeps commodity products like edible oil, soap, detergent, salt, potatoes, etc. in her shop. When she gets the loan from WSDS, she plans to expand her shop and refill it so that she will have sufficient stocks to provide her customers' needs even during economic blockades. Besides her low-budget business, Thangakim and the other group members are engaged in seasonal farming like planting bananas, ginger, onions and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy grocery items and refill the shop.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario, esta casado vive en casa propia con su esposa en la zona de sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja en el Hospital de la Caja Nacional de Salud (si bien ya tiene su jubilación) y la esposa vende verduras en la puerta de su casa.

El crédito que solicita es para la refacción de las gradas de su casa y el colocado de techo y de esta forma darle un mejor ambiente a su esposa y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mario is married and lives with his wife in a house of their own, located in Sopocachi, city of La Paz. He works at the “Caja Nacional de Salud” Hospital (although he is retired) and his wife sells vegetables at home.

Mario is requesting a loan to fix the stairs and roof of his house. This way, he will provide his wife with a better environment and better living conditions.

loans.use: to repair the stairs and roof of his house.

loans.name: Ever Green Group

texts.en:
This is Ever Green group. They hail from a remote tribal village that is 25 kms away from the city of Imphal in the northeastern region of India. These five hard working women formed themselves a group in order to raise the bar economically, socially and financially. Since they are from an undeveloped area, they lack the facilities and privileges enjoyed by the so called elite groups. 

Gailunei is the featured borrower with her hand raised. She is a mother to two children. Her husband is a private school teacher in the village. Being in a private school, he does not get a salary regularly and therefore could not meet the family's needs. Hence, in order to eradicate the worries of the family, Gailunei opened a variety shop in the village. 

She keeps tobaccos, chips, soap, salt, candle sticks, matches and some daily essential products in her shop. Through the loan she avails from Kiva, she plans to expand the shop as well as store enough stock so that the shop will never run out of stock even during general strikes and economic blockades. 

She also wishes to raise her two children by sending them to good school and providing them quality education. Her children are her source of inspiration. She appreciates WDSD/Kiva for being gracious to her and the group.   

The rest of the women are engaged in weaving, ginger plantation and vegetable cultivation to generate more income.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks and expand the shop.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra is 40 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in San Vicente, Sinacaban, Philippines.  Myra is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living, which she has been doing for 10 years. 

Myra is requesting a loan from PMPC, which she will use to purchase additional feeds and other supplies such as water disinfection sprayer, veterinary medicines, vaccines, etc.  She has been a member of PMPC for six months. In the future, Myra hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and other supplies

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is married and has four children.  She sells petrol, diesel, and kerosene out of her house.  She opened her kiosk a year ago with working capital of $400.00. She lives near the main road and has many customers.

Angela is requesting a loan for $1,000, which she will use to buy more petrol, diesel, and kerosene to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy petrol, diesel, and  kerosene

loans.name: Ganphiu Group

texts.en:
